0.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st Test against Sri Lanka
0.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bat first in first Test against Sri Lanka at the IS Bindra Punjab Cricket Association Stadium in Mohali. India's playing XI features Hanuma Vihari, Jayant Yadav and Mohammad Shami. Virat Kohli is featuring in his 100th Test, while Rohit is leading India in a Test for the first time.

1.title: Google suspends all ad sales in Russia amid invasion of Ukraine
1.article_body: Google announced that it has suspended all ad sales in Russia, a ban that covers search, YouTube and outside publishing partners, amid Ukraine's invasion citing "extraordinary circumstances". "The situation is evolving quickly, and we will continue to share updates," it said. Earlier, Russia had reportedly told Google not to show YouTube ads with "false political information" about Ukraine.

2.title: 2 held for assaulting 40-yr-old man to death in Delhi's Sadar Bazar
2.article_body: Police arrested two suspects after a 40-year-old man was assaulted to death by three men in Delhi's Sadar Bazar. The prime suspect is absconding and is suspected to have fled to his native place in Nepal, police said. "The prime suspect was enraged with the victim and his family...they had assaulted him and his father over a quarrel," police added.

3.title: 2 farmers booked for planting banned opium poppies in farmland in Pune
3.article_body: Pune Rural Police has booked two farmers from Indapur for allegedly planting banned opium poppies in their farmland. According to police, the accused had illegally planted banned opium poppies in between groundnut and garlic plants in their farmlands. Police seized 1,100 opium poppy plants worth around ₹2.11 lakh from the farmlands during a raid.

4.title: He has refused to stop attacks on Ukraine: Macron after call with Putin
4.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron said that he spoke to Russian President Vladimir Putin over the phone, and he has "refused to stop his attacks on Ukraine at this point". "It is vital to maintain dialogue to avoid human tragedy. I will continue my efforts and contacts. We must avoid the worst," Macron said in a Twitter post.

5.title: 4 women rescued as Pune police bust sex racket; 1 arrested
5.article_body: Pune City Police have rescued four women, including an Uzbekistan national, as they busted an alleged sex racket, a press release said on Thursday. A 28-year-old purported agent has been arrested by the police. The police team had set a trap in Sakore Nagar following a tip-off and arrested the accused who'd arrived there with the women in an autorickshaw.

6.title: 3 students from Nashik drown at Palghar beach while trying to save 13-yr-old boy
6.article_body: Three college students from Nashik, all aged 17 years, drowned while trying to save a 13-year-old boy at Kelwa beach in Palghar, police said. The students had come to the beach for a picnic. The 13-year-old boy also drowned in the incident. Another student, who was also pulled in by strong currents of the sea, was saved by local fishermen.

7.title: Indian student shot at in Ukraine: Union Minister VK Singh
7.article_body: Union Minister VK Singh told ANI, "I received information that an [Indian] student coming from Ukraine's Kyiv was shot at and was taken back midway." "We're trying for maximum evacuation with minimum loss," he further said. Earlier, a 21-year-old Indian student named Naveen Shekharappa was killed in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv.

8.title: Ukraine Foreign Minister shares pic of 9-storey residential building after missile attack
8.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has shared a picture of a completely burnt nine-floor apartment building in Borodyanka, Kyiv after it was destroyed following a missile attack by Russia. He tweeted, "Each time when Russian liars say they don’t drop bombs on Ukrainian cities...show this photo...Russians bombed the town for two days...killing many civilians. Stop barbaric Russia now."

9.title: Indian news anchor shouts at wrong guest on live TV for 2 minutes, video goes viral
9.article_body: A video of a news channel's debate on Ukraine crisis went viral after the anchor shouted at a guest for two minutes before realising he was shouting at the wrong person. Mistaking Ukrainian panellist Bohdan Nahaylo as American panellist Daniel McAdams, the anchor said, "Don't lecture us Mr McAdams." Moments later, McAdams said, "I'm Mr McAdams...so stop yelling at me!"

10.title: UK's richest woman Denise Coates earns $400 million in a year from her betting company
10.article_body: Denise Coates, the 54-year-old Founder and CEO of Bet365, received £300 million ($400 million) in pay and dividends in a year despite a salary cut, according to a filing by the online bookmaker. The UK's richest woman has earned more than $1.8 billion over the past decade, according to Bloomberg. Her salary makes her one of the world's best-compensated bosses.

11.title: K'taka HC bans protests, rallies in B'luru except at Freedom Park
11.article_body: Karnataka High Court on Thursday directed the state government to ensure that no protests or processions take place in Bengaluru except at Freedom Park. This comes after Congress' Mekedatu Padayatra caused traffic disruption in the city for the past few days. "It took us one hour to get to...High Court. How're regular people supposed to get around?" the bench said.

12.title: AAP MLA from Delhi sustains serious injuries in road accident in UP
12.article_body: An Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA from Delhi, Akhilesh Pati Tripathi, on Thursday sustained serious injuries in a road accident in Uttar Pradesh, the party said. His car overturned on the Lucknow-Agra Expressway in Unnao while he was returning from the Assembly poll campaigning. Tripathi, an MLA from Delhi's Model Town, was rushed to a hospital in Lucknow for treatment.

13.title: Fire breaks out at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine after Russia attack
13.article_body: Russian shelling has led to a fire at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "Russian army is firing from all sides upon Zaporizhzhia NPP...If it blows up, it will be 10 times larger than Chernobyl! Russians must immediately cease the fire, allow firefighters, establish a security zone," Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba tweeted.

14.title: I'm no good at networking: Sushmita Sen on not getting Bollywood roles
14.article_body: Sushmita Sen in a recent interaction with film critic Sucharita Tyagi, talked about her absence from acting for almost 10 years. Speaking about how she found it hard to get roles upon her return, the actor said, mainstream Bollywood wasn't offering her what she wanted. "Maybe I wasn't putting myself out there...I am no good at networking," she added.

15.title: 45-year-old man arrested for raping street dog in Mumbai
15.article_body: A 45-year-old man was arrested by the Ambernath Police in Mumbai on Thursday for allegedly raping a street dog. "The incident was witnessed by a social worker and a family staying near the accused. They saw the dog in a bad condition and took it immediately to a hospital," a police official said, adding that the dog is stable.

16.title: 7-yr-old girl out to play sexually assaulted by 23-yr-old man in Pune
16.article_body: A 23-year-old man allegedly sexually assaulted a seven-year-old girl while she was playing near a bus stand in Pune. An investigation revealed that the man forcibly took the girl to the corner of the bus stand and allegedly assaulted her. "The people in the area caught him, when the girl raised an alarm," a police official was quoted as saying.

17.title: Mumbai man breaks traffic police's e-challan machine after being fined
17.article_body: A 26-year-old two-wheeler rider allegedly broke the e-challan machine of traffic police in Mumbai. A policeman had reportedly penalised him for jumping signal, following which he snatched the machine from his hands and threw it on the ground and fled away. However, he was later arrested and presented before the court, which remanded him to police custody for two days.

18.title: Can't promote drunkenness: Delhi govt on order stopping discount on liquor
18.article_body: Delhi government has told Delhi High Court that the national capital "couldn't become a city for promoting drunkenness through discounts on liquor." The giving of discounts by liquor vends was an attempt by a few to "monopolise" the whole system, it added. It comes as private liquor sellers challenged Delhi government's order which barred them from giving discounts on alcohol.

19.title: Russia, Ukraine agree on humanitarian corridors to evacuate civilians
19.article_body: Following the second round of negotiations between Russia and Ukraine, Russia has agreed on humanitarian corridors to evacuate civilians, a Ukrainian official said. "Unfortunately, the results Ukraine needs are not yet achieved," tweeted Ukraine's presidential advisor Mykhailo Podolyak. The other key issues on the agenda were immediate ceasefire and armistice.

20.title: 19 COVID-19 cases reported at German football club FSV Mainz 05
20.article_body: German club FSV Mainz 05 on Thursday said there were 19 confirmed COVID-19 cases amongst the first-team, including players, coaches and staff. Mainz said everyone involved in the first-team is "completely immunised", adding Thursday's team training session was cancelled and players who tested negative trained individually. Mainz's Bundesliga match on Sunday against Borussia Dortmund is in doubt.

21.title: Mumbai RPF's crime prevention team nabs 2 robbers; seizes phone, cash
21.article_body: The crime prevention team of RPF Central Railway Mumbai division nabbed two robbers on Tuesday. The incident happened at the railway yard of LTT when both accused beat up a passenger and tried to escape after robbing him of cash, his phone and charger. The two accused, Ganesh Telange, 23, and Ganesh Kewat, 18, accepted their crime during preliminary investigation.

22.title: Told mother I'll think about marriage after Baahubali: Prabhas
22.article_body: Actor Prabhas, while talking about his work and family, said that his family has been pressurising him to "get married and have kids". The 42-year-old further said that he'd told his mother he'll think about marriage after his  film 'Baahubali'. He shared that while he too wishes to settle down, he feels that "it'll happen at the right time".

23.title: Actor Randeep Hooda gets hurt during shoot, undergoes knee surgery
23.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda on Wednesday underwent knee surgery at a Mumbai hospital after sustaining an injury on the set of his upcoming series 'Inspector Avinash'. The actor reportedly suffered the injury while filming a combat sequence for the series in February. A source close to the actor informed that he hurt the same knee he had injured while filming 'Radhe'.

24.title: 2 Tripura students return from Ukraine, felicitated by CM Biplab Deb
24.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb on Thursday met with two students who reached the state safely from Ukraine. The CM felicitated both the students and thanked PM Narendra Modi for his efforts to evacuate Indian students from Ukraine. Responding to questions regarding the number of Tripura students stuck in Ukraine, the CM said that exact figures weren't available.

25.title: Tens of millions of lives at risk in Ukraine: UN Human Rights Chief
25.article_body: The UN Human Rights Chief Michelle Bachelet on Thursday said tens of millions of lives are at risk in Ukraine as Russia continues its invasion of the country, which began last week. Ukraine's First Deputy Foreign Minister Emine Dzhaparova said Russian troops fighting in Ukraine "systematically engage in acts that clearly amount to war crimes and crimes against humanity".

26.title: 'I don't bite,' says Ukraine President as he asks Putin to 'sit down' for negotiation
26.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has asked his Russian counterpart Putin to "sit down" for negotiation amid the ongoing war between both the countries. "I don't bite. What are you afraid of?" Zelenskyy further said. "Words are more important than shots," he added while stating that it was sensible to have talks.

27.title: It was nice to meet you, jokes Pak's Fakhar as fan shares 'long distance' selfie
27.article_body: Pakistan batter Fakhar Zaman took to Twitter to react to a 'long distance' selfie taken by a fan from the stands during a Pakistan Super League match. In the picture, Fakhar is not clearly visible as he was near the boundary rope. Commenting on the picture, Fakhar wrote, "It was nice to meet you."

28.title: 249 civilians dead, 553 injured in Ukraine: UN Human Rights Office
28.article_body: The UN Human Rights Office on Thursday said it has confirmed that 249 civilians have died and 553 have been injured in Ukraine since Russia's invasion began last week. However, Ukraine's emergency service on Wednesday said over 2,000 civilians have been killed so far. The UN Human Rights Office added it believes the true death toll is "considerably higher".

29.title: Sit down with me, just not at 30 metres: Ukraine President to Russia's Putin
29.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday called for Russian President Vladimir Putin to "sit down" with him for negotiation. "Sit down with me to negotiate, just not at 30 metres," Zelenskyy said. Reports said he was apparently referring to recent photos of Putin sitting at one end of an extremely long table when he met with French President Emmanuel Macron.

30.title: Rahul shares video of student criticising govt on return from Ukraine
30.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday shared a video of an Indian female student who criticised the government's evacuation process from Ukraine. Rahul said evacuation is a duty and not a favour. "We are brought back on a flight from Romania, which is a safe country. So how can you call this evacuation?" the student had said in the video.

31.title: 34-yr-old kills his father in Goa for rejecting marriage proposals
31.article_body: A 34-year-old man killed his father in Goa after blaming him for rejecting marriage proposals. The accused, identified as Rajesh Gaonkar, attacked his 65-year-old father Ganesh Gaonkar with an iron rod. Police said the murder's cause was understood to be constant bickering with his father over marriage and his father not letting him get married.

32.title: CBI refutes Indrani Mukerjea’s claim that Sheena Bora is alive
32.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has refuted former media executive Indrani Mukerjea's claim that her daughter Sheena Bora is alive and residing in Srinagar. Responding to Mukerjea's plea for an investigation of the claim, the agency said, "The plea filed by Mukerjea is frivolous, in which wild claims are made that are not sustainable."

33.title: IPO-bound LIC appoints insurance veteran Sunil Agrawal as CFO: Reports
33.article_body: LIC has appointed former Reliance Nippon Life Insurance CFO Sunil Agrawal as the IPO-bound insurer's CFO, Bloomberg reported. Agrawal served as Nippon's CFO for 12 years till 2018. Prior to that, he worked for ICICI Prudential Life Insurance for five years. He replaced LIC Executive Director Shubhangi Soman and is the first outsider to be appointed to the position.

34.title: Over 97% of adults have received 1st COVID-19 vaccine dose: Govt
34.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya tweeted on Thursday that over 97% of India's adult population has received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. "Rapidly marching towards achieving 100% first dose mark," he added. Notably, at a press meet today, ICMR's Dr Balram Bhargava said the first dose of vaccine is 98.9% effective in preventing mortality.

35.title: Chelsea reach FA Cup quarters as Abramovich announces club is up for sale
35.article_body: Hours after Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich announced he is putting the club up for sale, Chelsea beat Luton Town 3-2 to reach the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. Chelsea's £97.5 million record signing Romelu Lukaku scored the winning goal in the fifth-round match. Abramovich has owned the London-based club for nearly 20 years. Chelsea were FA Cup finalists last year.

36.title: Liverpool beat Norwich City 2-1 to reach FA Cup quarter-finals
36.article_body: Liverpool's Takumi Minamino on Wednesday scored twice to help Liverpool beat Norwich City 2-1 and reach the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. Liverpool beat Chelsea on penalties to win the Carabao Cup on Sunday. "Takumi is an incredible player and tonight was the best game he had for us. He was a constant threat throughout," Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said.

37.title: If you can't close the skies, then give me planes: Ukraine President to the West
37.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called on the West to increase military aid to Ukraine and said, "If you do not have the power to close the skies, then give me planes!" "If we (Ukraine) are no more then, God forbid, Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia will be next. Believe me," Zelenskyy warned.

38.title: Delhi reports 326 COVID-19 cases, 3 deaths in last 24 hrs
38.article_body: Delhi reported 326 new COVID-19 cases and three related deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,60,887. Moreover, 338 recoveries were reported in the national capital, with the city currently having 1,588 active cases. The city had reported 325 COVID-19 cases and one death on Wednesday.

39.title: Muslims living in fear, Brahmins neglected under BJP: Mayawati
39.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party president Mayawati on Thursday said, "Muslims are living under constant fear. They have been meted step-motherly treatment by the BJP government. The Brahmin community, too, has been feeling neglected." Mayawati further said that BSP has given tickets to candidates of all communities. "The Muslim community is full of hate against the BJP and the RSS," she added.

40.title: Yet to examine it: Govt on IIT study predicting 4th wave in June
40.article_body: The Centre on Thursday said it's yet to examine the IIT Kanpur study which said that the COVID-19 fourth wave in India may start around June 22 and peak from mid to late August. NITI Aayog Member (Health) VK Paul said the study is a valuable input produced by eminent people. "We should be carefully watching the assumption," he added.

41.title: Russian, Belarusian athletes banned from Winter Paralympics: IPC
41.article_body: The International Paralympic Committee (IPC) on Thursday said Russian and Belarusian athletes will be banned from the Winter Paralympics. The decision comes after the IPC faced international backlash and threats of boycotts by other teams for announcing a day before the athletes would be allowed to compete as neutrals. A 71-member Russian contingent and 12-member Belarusian team are in Beijing.

42.title: F1's Max Verstappen signs new deal with Red Bull until end of 2028
42.article_body: Formula One world champion Max Verstappen on Thursday signed a new five-year contract extension with Red Bull keeping him at the team until the end of 2028. "I really enjoy being part of Red Bull Racing, so choosing to stay to the 2028 season was an easy decision," Verstappen said. The new deal is reportedly worth £40 million per season.

43.title: 2 dead, 14 hurt as bus falls into gorge in Himachal's Mandi
43.article_body: Two people were killed and 14 others were left injured as a Himachal Road Transport Corporation bus fell into a gorge in Mandi district, police have said. Mandi Superintendent of Police Shalini Agnihotri informed that the accident took place on Thursday at Jhir village of Sarkaghat sub-division. The injured people were taken for treatment to a nearby hospital.

44.title: 35-yr-old arrested in Thane for cheating 35 people of ₹2.56 crore
44.article_body: Thane Police have arrested a 35-year-old man for cheating 35 people of ₹2.56 crores after the promise of giving three times higher returns on their investments. An officer from the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) said, "The accused had taken money from people on a time-to-time basis within a year's span in 2020."

45.title: 'France Prez believes worst is yet to come,' says aide after 90-minute call with Putin
45.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron believes "the worst is yet to come" in Ukraine after a 90-minute phone call with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin who appears intent on seizing "the whole" of Ukraine, Macron's aide said. "There was nothing in what President Putin told us that should reassure us. He showed great determination to continue the operation," the aide continued.

46.title: 8 people can return in its place: BJP MLA on bringing student's body from Ukraine
46.article_body: When asked about bringing Karnataka resident Naveen SG's body from war-hit Ukraine, BJP MLA Arvind Bellad on Thursday said, "In the place required for a dead body, eight persons could be accommodated and brought back." Saying that efforts are underway, he added, "Bringing those who are alive is difficult, so bringing a dead body back would be even more difficult."

47.title: Djokovic likely to play French Open as France drops vaccine rule
47.article_body: World number two Novak Djokovic will likely be able to play at French Open in May after France announced it will drop its COVID-19 vaccine pass rule from March 14. Djokovic won the title in 2021, beating world number five Stefanos Tsitsipas in five sets. Djokovic was deported ahead of the Australian Open due to his COVID-19 vaccine status.

48.title: Can't promote drunkenness: Delhi govt on order stopping discount on liquor
48.article_body: Delhi government has told Delhi High Court that the national capital "couldn't become a city for promoting drunkenness through discounts on liquor." The giving of discounts by liquor vends was an attempt by a few to "monopolise" the whole system, it added. It comes as private liquor sellers challenged Delhi government's order which barred them from giving discounts on alcohol.

49.title: Turkish AI startup Insider turns unicorn with $121 mn fundraise
49.article_body: Turkish AI startup Insider has become a unicorn after raising $121 million in a funding round led by Qatar's sovereign wealth fund. Insider is now valued at $1.22 billion, triple of what it was valued two years ago. Founded in 2012, the startup's platform uses artificial intelligence to predict future consumption behaviour for clients like Samsung, Toyota and Ikea.

50.title: Drugs, liquor worth over ₹600 crore seized in 2yrs: Gujarat govt
50.article_body: Gujarat government in a written response in the Assembly on Thursday said drugs and liquor worth over ₹600 crore were seized in the state over the last two years. In a break-up, it revealed police confiscated India-made foreign liquor bottles, country liquor and beer cans worth ₹235 crore and hashish, ganja and charas worth ₹370 crore in 2020 and 2021.

51.title: Chhattisgarh CM rides bike in leather jacket to promote competition; video viral
51.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel wore a leather jacket, shades and rode a bike to promote a bike racing competition organised by the Chhattisgarh Motor Sports Association. In a video posted by the Chief Minister's Office on Twitter, Baghel is seen riding the bike, while Punjabi music is playing in the background. "Let's make this weekend memorable," his office tweeted.

52.title: No parent wants to send their child away: PM Modi to Ukraine-returned students
52.article_body: PM Narendra Modi in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi interacted with several Indian medical students who had returned from war-hit Ukraine. The PM said, "I believe, students like you would not have needed to go outside India had the medical education policies been right since the beginning." He added, "No parent wants to send their child away at a small age."

53.title: Man marries triplets on same day after all 3 sisters propose to him in Congo
53.article_body: A man in Democratic Republic of Congo married triplets on the same day and said that they proposed to him simultaneously. "I was obliged to marry all of them because they are triplets. It wasn't an easy decision because until now, my parents don't understand what I'm doing," the man said. Pictures of their wedding are being widely shared online

54.title: 2nd round of Russia-Ukraine talks begins, Ukraine lists 3 key issues
54.article_body: The second round of Russia-Ukraine ceasefire talks has begun, tweeted a Ukrainian official. The key issues on the agenda are immediate ceasefire, armistice and humanitarian corridors for the evacuation of civilians from destroyed or constantly shelled villages/cities, the official further wrote. The Ukrainian official also shared a picture along with the tweet.

55.title: Rohit misinterprets meaning of 'anban' during presser, says 'My Hindi isn't that good'
55.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma misinterpreted the meaning of Hindi word 'anban' while answering a question about whether he has set any targets having played just 40 Tests till now. Rohit answered, "I'm happy having played 40 Tests...I had several injuries and 'anban' during my career." Rohit then asked the meaning of 'anban' and said, "My Hindi isn't that good, boss."

56.title: China-led Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank freezes Russia lending
56.article_body: China-led Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) on Thursday said it has put all activities relating to Russia and Belarus on hold and under review owing to the Russia-Ukraine war. China, despite being the Bank's largest shareholder and holding 26.5% of AIIB's voting power, has opposed sanctions imposed on Russia by governments of various countries.

57.title: 76-year-old woman arrested in Russia for opposing invasion of Ukraine
57.article_body: A 76-year-old woman was reportedly arrested in Russia as she protested against the country's invasion of Ukraine. A video showing some police officers arresting the woman, who is reportedly the survivor of World War II, has also gone viral online. The woman was reportedly carrying a sign that said, "Soldier, drop your weapon and you will be a true hero."

58.title: 'There is much to life than cricket': Jharkhand's Virat shares Dhoni's advice
58.article_body: Sharing MS Dhoni's advice while playing together for Jharkhand in the 2016-17 season, Jharkhand batter Virat Singh said, "Failures on the cricket ground shouldn't dictate your life. There is much to life than cricket." "It is a game, one day you will score a century and the next day, you might get out without scoring," added Virat.

59.title: Mamata Banerjee having Prime Ministerial illusions: BJP leader
59.article_body: BJP leader Tathagata Roy on Thursday said that West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is having "Prime Ministerial illusions", which is why she's interfering in an international issue. Banerjee on Wednesday blamed the government for delaying the evacuation of Indian students from Ukraine. The Ministry of External Affairs on Thursday said that 6,400 Indians have been brought back so far.

60.title: Time to send Yogi back to his mutt: Mayawati
60.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party president Mayawati said that her party will form the government in Uttar Pradesh and will send Yogi Adityanath "back to his mutt". "Seeing this turnout and its enthusiasm, I can say that you are set to bring the BSP back to power and make your 'behenji' the Chief Minister for the fifth time," Mayawati added.

61.title: Vodafone Idea to raise ₹4,500 crore by issuing shares to promoters
61.article_body: Vodafone Idea (Vi) on Thursday said its board has approved raising ₹4,500 crore by issuing shares to its promoters on preferential basis. The firm will issue up to 3.39 billion shares at ₹13.30 a share, 20% premium to its current market price, to Vodafone Group's Euro Pacific Securities and Prime Metals and Aditya Birla Group's (ABG) Oriana Investments.

62.title: Prosecutor of ICC launches investigation into war crimes in Ukraine
62.article_body: The International Criminal Court (ICC) Chief Prosecutor Karim Khan on Wednesday announced he has launched an investigation into war crimes, genocide and crimes against humanity committed during Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The investigation comes after 39 member states referred for an investigation from the ICC. Ukraine has said over 2,000 civilians have died since the invasion began last week.

63.title: Ukrainian soldiers beat us: Rajasthan students after returning from Ukraine
63.article_body: Indian medical students who returned to Rajasthan from war-hit Ukraine said the situation at the country's border with Romania was "horrific". "Ukrainian soldiers were treating us very badly. They were beating boys, firing tear gas shells and also bullets in the air," a female student said. A male student said, "They kicked a girl in front of me. She fainted."

64.title: BJP made Purvanchal education hub, opposition neglected it: Shah
64.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that the BJP government made Purvanchal an education hub, while the opposition neglected it earlier. "We made universities in Azamgarh, Ballia and Gorakhpur, along with 12 new medical colleges in the region," Shah added. He further said that BJP has freed UP of the mafia.

65.title: Will impose more sanctions on Russia if situation deteriorates: EU
65.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Thursday said the EU will impose more sanctions on Russia if the situation in Ukraine deteriorates any further following Russia's invasion. The EU has already imposed travel, export, financial and energy bans. "Our aim is to cut off the Kremlin's capacity to wage war on its neighbours," von der Leyen said.

66.title: Video shows captured Ukrainian soldiers being forced to say 'Glory to Russia'
66.article_body: A video purportedly showing captured Ukrainian soldiers being forced to say 'Glory to Russia' has surfaced online. The group of around 15 soldiers can be seen standing at the side of a road as they are recorded by a man. One of the soldiers was told to repeat the phrase loudly by the man behind the camera.

67.title: It's cold, you're wearing just shirt: Rijiju to Indian before evacuation
67.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju who is in Slovakia to see the evacuation of Indian students from Ukraine checked basic facilities for them. In a video shared by him on social media, Rijiju asked one of the Indians, "It is cold...you are wearing just a shirt. I feel cold looking at you." Other students standing there were seen laughing at this.

68.title: Few hundred citizens still remain in Ukraine's Kharkiv: Govt
68.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Thursday said a few hundred Indian nationals are still stuck in Kharkiv of war-hit Ukraine. "Our priority is to take students out safely in whatever mode of transport possible," he said. "The total number of Indians waiting to cross Ukraine's western borders has reduced," he claimed.

69.title: Tried other options before 'I'm Iron Man' line: Robert Downey Jr
69.article_body: Actor Robert Downey Jr recently said in a podcast that before choosing the 'I am Iron Man' line for his character Tony Stark's last words in 'Avengers: Endgame', he tried other lines. He continued, "They were all...smart-a** lines like...dumb stuff like, 'You're so f***ed' or whatever." The actor revealed the final line was one of the editors' or writers' idea.

70.title: Melt snow for water, avoid full meals: Govt in survival guidelines for Indians in Ukraine
70.article_body: In an advisory for Indian citizens in Ukraine, government listed survival guidelines, wherein it asked them to keep a kit of essential items, including passport, ID Card, essential medication, at hand round the clock. "Avoid full meals, eat smaller portions to extend the rations...Melt snow to make water," it added. "Delete...unnecessary apps in mobile...to conserve battery," said government.

71.title: Indian govt lists dos and don'ts in advisory for its citizens in Ukraine
71.article_body: Indian government, in an advisory for its citizens in Ukraine, listed out potentially dangerous situations to be expected, including aerial raids and missile attacks. "Compile and share information with...fellow Indians, organise yourselves in squads...of ten...students, nominate a coordinator," said government. "Do not join local protestors, refrain from commenting on social media," it added.

72.title: We will restore every house, every street, Russia will pay for it: Ukraine
72.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday said, "We will restore every house, every street and every city destroyed in the war." Zelenskyy said, "We say to Russia: Learn the word of reparations and contributions." He added, "You (Russia) will reimburse us for everything you did against our state, against every Ukrainian in full."

73.title: Man shares pic of son resting on his uniform as he goes to fight for Ukraine
73.article_body: A Ukrainian man has shared a picture of his son, who can be seen resting on his military uniform as he prepared to fight for the country amid the Russian invasion. The man tweeted, "[Goodbye] my little boy...I hope [to] see you [the other] time I survive." Over 2,000 Ukrainian civilians have reportedly been killed so far since Russia's invasion.

74.title: Russia will achieve its goal in Ukraine in any case: Putin
74.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday told his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron that the goals of Russia's operation in Ukraine - its demilitarisation and neutral status - will be achieved in any case. Putin added that any attempts by Kyiv to delay negotiations would result in Moscow adding more items to its list of demands.

75.title: Kerala, Mizoram & Maha have 50% of India's active COVID cases: Govt
75.article_body: The Union Health Ministry on Thursday said Kerala, Maharashtra and Mizoram accounted for 50% of the active COVID-19 cases in India. At present, the country has around 77,000 active cases. Only a single state has active cases over 10,000 and two states have active cases between 5,000 and 10,000, while remaining states have below 5,000 active cases, the ministry said.

76.title: Ford names its EV unit 'Model e', the name it stopped Elon Musk from using
76.article_body: Ford has split its business into two separate entities, one focused on electric vehicles and the other on gas-powered ones. Ford named its electric vehicle unit 'Ford Model e' and the gasoline division 'Ford Blue'. Nearly a decade ago, Ford had stopped Elon Musk's Tesla from naming its car 'Model E' and Tesla eventually named its car 'Model 3'.

77.title: 18,000 Indians left Ukraine since we first issued advisory: MEA
77.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Thursday said a total of 18,000 Indian nationals have left Ukraine since the first travel advisory was issued by the Indian Embassy in Kyiv. "30 flights under Operation Ganga have brought back 6,400 Indians from Ukraine so far. In the next 24 hours, 18 flights have been scheduled," said MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi.

78.title: Ensure you're vaccinated against COVID-19: Govt to Ukraine returnees
78.article_body: The government on Thursday asked all students who have returned from war-hit Ukraine to get fully vaccinated against COVID-19 if they haven't done so already. Health Ministry's Lav Agarwal said the ministry is in regular touch with the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) over how many flights and people have come from Ukraine and their health status as well.

79.title: Ukrainian woman killed while trying to recover 14-yr-old nephew's body
79.article_body: A nurse has been killed in an ambush by Russian forces while she was trying to recover her 14-year-old nephew's body, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said. The woman's nephew was reportedly killed by shrapnel after the Russian bombing. Ukraine's Healthcare Minister Viktor Liashko said, "Today Russian terrorists took the life of a doctor – Marina Kalabina...[This] should definitely not go unpunished."

80.title: Eveready's Chairman & MD resign post open offer from Burman family
80.article_body: Eveready's Non-Executive Chairman Aditya Khaitan and Managing Director Amritanshu Khaitan resigned from their positions following an open offer from Dabur Group's Burman family to buy an additional 26% stake in Eveready. The company said the two have stepped down "to enable [Eveready] to benefit from new leadership and direction". Joint MD Suvamoy Saha will assume charge as Eveready's interim MD.

81.title: Chennai to get its youngest Mayor as DMK names 28-yr-old R Priya for post
81.article_body: DMK on Thursday named 28-year-old R Priya as the mayoral candidate for Chennai. As DMK enjoys the majority, Priya would be formally elected as Chennai's youngest Mayor soon. Priya will be the first-ever Dalit woman and the third woman after Tara Cherian and Kamakshi Jayaraman to lead the body. She is the granddaughter of former DMK MLA Chengai Sivam.

82.title: Formula 1 terminates contract with Russian Grand Prix
82.article_body: Formula 1 has confirmed that it has terminated its contract with the Russian Grand Prix amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Formula 1 had earlier cancelled the race scheduled to take place in Sochi in September. Formula 1's governing body, FIA, had ruled that Russian drivers must compete under a neutral flag this season.

83.title: 1 million people have fled Ukraine in 7 days since Russia invasion: UN
83.article_body: The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) Filippo Grandi on Wednesday said that about one million people have fled Ukraine since Russia invaded the country on February 24. Filippo Grandi said, "In just seven days, we have witnessed the exodus of one million refugees from Ukraine to neighbouring countries." Notably, the Russia-Ukraine war entered its eighth day today.

84.title: Man ties wife & her alleged lover, beats them with baton in Raj
84.article_body: A man was arrested for beating his wife and her alleged lover after tying them up to a pillar in Rajasthan's Udaipur district, police said on Thursday. The accused, identified as Kanhaiya Lal, beat the man till he fainted and later shaved his head, said Station House Officer (SHO) of Pahada Police Station Nagendra Singh.

85.title: Satellite pic shows people waiting in long queue for food in Ukraine
85.article_body: A satellite image by Maxar amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine shows long queue of people waiting for essentials outside a shop. The long queue waiting for food was seen outside a supermarket in Kyiv. People and cars trying to leave Ukraine at multiple border crossing points and into neighbouring countries including Hungary and Slovakia are also seen in pictures.

86.title: 18-month-old Hyd girl kidnapped from hospital, rescued within 4 hours
86.article_body: An 18-month-old girl who was kidnapped from the Niloufer Hospital at Hyderabad's Nampally on Wednesday morning was rescued within four hours, police said. The child had gone to the hospital along with her mother. While her mother was busy collecting reports, the girl went missing within a few minutes.

87.title: Nobody should say what India should do, its voice matters: France on Russia-Ukraine war
87.article_body: After India abstained from voting on the resolution against Russia at UNSC, French Ambassador to India Emmanuel Lenain on Thursday said, "Nobody should say what India should do." "As crisis is deepening, support from India would be welcomed because India's voice matters," he stated. He added that France is a strong supporter of India getting a permanent seat in UNSC.

88.title: Interviewer jokingly makes Zuckerberg complete CAPTCHA to prove he's 'not a robot'
88.article_body: Computer scientist Lex Fridman recently interviewed Mark Zuckerberg where he jokingly made the Meta CEO complete a CAPTCHA to prove that he is "not a robot". Fridman asked Zuckerberg to circle all the traffic lights on a paper presented to him. CAPTCHA is a type of challenge-response test used in computing to determine whether the user is human.

89.title: I had no idea there was such a shortfall of medical colleges in India: Mahindra
89.article_body: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Thursday tweeted, "I had no idea that there was such a shortfall  of medical colleges in India." The billionaire tweeted this in response to a graphic that listed the top destinations for Indian medical students and the number of students who are there. It stated that 23,000 Indian medical students are in China alone.

90.title: Man sexually harasses woman passenger on Delhi-B'luru flight; booked
90.article_body: A man allegedly sexually harassed a 34-year-old woman passenger mid-air on a flight to Bengaluru from Delhi, a report said. The woman alleged the accused tried to speak with her a few times, touched her inappropriately and started leaning on her shoulders 30 minutes after the flight took off. Meanwhile, Bengaluru's airport police have booked the man following the incident.

91.title: Mumbai Police banishes 2 women for 1 year over drug racket
91.article_body: The Mumbai Police banished two women for a year for allegedly running a network of drug peddlers in the absence of their jailed husbands. While 33-year-old Tehseen Bano Ali Sheikh allegedly ran the drug racket from eastern Mumbai, 30-year-old Firdous Rashid Sheikh was a key gang member. Both are residents of Trombay. This punishment is usually given to habitual criminals.

92.title: Man dies after entering Pune septic tank, wife says he was forced to do it
92.article_body: The wife of a 36-year-old tenant, who died while trying to rescue three workers cleaning a septic tank in Pune, has alleged that her husband was forced to enter it by the building's owner. In her FIR, the woman also said that no protective gear and safety equipment was given by the owner. Police arrested the owner on Thursday.

93.title: Delhi man succumbs to injuries days after he was found in pool of blood
93.article_body: A 40-year-old man succumbed to the injuries he received after being beaten up by some people in Delhi's Sadar Bazar area, police said. The man was taken to hospital by his nephew who saw him lying in a pool of blood near Rui Mandi on Sunday. Deputy Commissioner of Police (North) said one person has been arrested in this connection.

94.title: SIT formed to probe the death of 16-yr-old DPS Faridabad student
94.article_body: Faridabad Police on Wednesday formed a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to investigate the case filed by the mother of the 16-year-old Delhi Public School (DPS) Faridabad student, who allegedly died by suicide on February 24. The mother alleged that her child was harassed over his sexuality and despite complaining to school authorities several times, her complaints were ignored.

95.title: 650 Delhi residents stuck in Ukraine, 215 returned: Officials
95.article_body: Around 650 Delhi residents are still stuck in Ukraine, while 215 people belonging to the city have been brought back, Delhi government officials said on Thursday. "The Delhi government is constantly in touch with the families of those stranded in Ukraine," said Transport Minister of Delhi, Kailash Gahlot. Families of over 600 such students were contacted over phone, officials added.

96.title: Chennai to gets its youngest Mayor as DMK names 28-yr-old R Priya for post
96.article_body: DMK on Thursday named 28-year-old R Priya as the mayoral candidate for Chennai. As DMK enjoys the majority, Priya would be formally elected as Chennai's youngest Mayor soon. Priya will be the first-ever Dalit woman and the third woman after Tara Cherian and Kamakshi Jayaraman to lead the body. Priya is the granddaughter of former DMK MLA Chengai Sivam.

97.title: Photo from space shows houses burning in Ukraine
97.article_body: A satellite photo released by Maxar Technologies shows burning houses in Ukraine's Rivnopillya amid war with Russia. Shelling and bombings have been witnessed in several cities of Ukraine since Russia announced military operations in the country. Several other satellite images showed burning factories, craters and damaged bridge in other cities.

98.title: COVID vaccine efficiency is 98.9% post 1st dose, 99.3% post 2nd: ICMR
98.article_body: ICMR chief Dr Balram Bhargava on Thursday said vaccine effectiveness in mortality prevention has been measured. "The first dose is responsible for 98.9% vaccine effectiveness and if both doses are given then it is 99.3% effective," Dr Bhargava said. "During 2022, 92% of deaths have been due to unvaccinated individuals," he added.

99.title: South Korean Prime Minister Kim Boo-kyum tests positive for COVID-19
99.article_body: South Korean Prime Minister Kim Boo-kyum's office on Thursday said he has tested positive for COVID-19. "He was coughing a bit this morning but is now only having mild cold symptoms," an official said. His office added that Boo-kyum has begun receiving treatment at home. The Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency on Wednesday reported 1,98,803 new COVID-19 cases.

100.title: Ikea suspends Russia, Belarus operations; 15,000 staff to be affected
100.article_body: Ikea on Thursday said it would suspend its operations in Russia and Belarus in response to the Russia-Ukraine war. The shutdown of operations will affect 15,000 employees, 17 stores and three production sites. "The war has had a huge human impact already. It is also resulting in serious disruptions to supply chain and trading conditions," the company said.

101.title: Ukrainian girl gives 'Stop Putin' poster to Prince Charles; pic surfaces
101.article_body: A picture showing a young Ukrainian girl giving a poster that said 'Stop Putin' to the UK's Prince Charles has surfaced online. The girl gave the poster to Charles as he visited the Ukrainian Catholic Cathedral in London to show solidarity with Ukrainians amid the Russian invasion. Charles also praised the "extraordinary bravery" of Ukrainian people amid "truly terrible aggression".

102.title: Let them fly on broomsticks: Russia as it stops delivering rocket engines to US
102.article_body: Russian state space agency Roscosmos' head Dmitry Rogozin has said that Russia has decided to stop supplying rocket engines to the US in retaliation for its sanctions over Ukraine. "In a situation like this we can't supply the United States with our world's best rocket engines. Let them fly on something else, their broomsticks, I don't know what," Rogozin added.

103.title: Ukrainians ride on top of captured Russian tank, shout 'We did it'; video viral
103.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media, showing a group of Ukrainians riding on top of a Russian tank they "captured". As the group laughed and cheered, one of the men shouted, "We did it" and "glory to Ukraine". Ukraine authorities have said that seized Russian tanks don't need to be declared on the tax form.

104.title: Asking women 'why don't they want kids' can affect their mental health: Debina
104.article_body: Actress Debina Bonnerjee shared a video in which she discussed how "it's not okay" to ask women pregnancy-related questions. She added it must be difficult for a woman in physical and mental distress to be asked questions like "when are they going to become a mother?" and "why don't they want kids?" by others who aren't aware of her situation.

105.title: Around 5 lakh people told to evacuate amid flood warnings in Sydney
105.article_body: Around five lakh Australians were ordered on Thursday to either evacuate their homes or prepare to flee floodwaters as heavy rains triggered flash floods in Sydney and across Australia's east coast over the past week. At least 13 people have died so far. Australia's Bureau of Meteorology has warned of fatal flash flooding and winds in excess of 90 kmph.

106.title: Don't give free gold: Varun to a fan who offered him free gold jewellery
106.article_body: A video surfaced online, in which a fan invited Varun Dhawan to visit her jewellery store. In the video, Varun is seen posing with her for pictures. Later, the fan tells him that she'll not charge him if he visits her store. Varun jokingly responds, "Don't give free gold." Then the fan clarifies she won't charge him any making charges.

107.title: Man dragged while getting down from moving train in Guj, video surfaces
107.article_body: The Railways Ministry tweeted a video on Tuesday showing a passenger being dragged on the platform after he tried to get down from a moving train at Surat railway station in Gujarat. Reportedly, the train was moving at 20 kmph when the incident happened. The man said to be in his 40s got saved after the guard applied emergency brakes.

108.title: France 'strongly' urges its citizens to leave Russia amid conflict
108.article_body: The French government has "strongly" urged its citizens to leave Russia if their presence is "not essential". This comes following Moscow's invasion of Ukraine and the closure of airspace between Russia and the European Union. The government also urged French citizens to "defer any trips to Russia". The US on Monday issued a similar appeal to American nationals in Russia.

109.title: Virat Kohli playing his 100th Test is momentous for Indian cricket: Ganguly
109.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has said that Virat Kohli playing his 100th Test in Mohali tomorrow is momentous for Indian cricket. "Virat has had a fantastic career. He still has time to achieve greater milestones," added Ganguly in a video message shared by BCCI. Virat will become the 12th Indian cricketer to play 100 Tests.

110.title: I dumped my bags to carry my dog: Indian girl seen in viral pic on escaping from Ukraine
110.article_body: Indian student Arya Aldrin, who carried her pet dog Zaira from Ukraine amid war, arrived in Delhi on Thursday. "At one stretch, I had to walk 20 km...At one point she was tired...so I dumped my bags to carry her," said Arya. "I was firm...Zaira will accompany me...Some people laughed at me," the 2nd year MBBS student from Kerala added.

111.title: 'Jhund' is a masterpiece and will make a lot of heads turn: Dhanush
111.article_body: Talking about Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Jhund', Dhanush said the movie is simply mind-blowing and a masterpiece, adding that the film will make a lot of heads turn and is an experience that everyone should go through. "Very happy to have witnessed this magic. Speechless. Simply fantastic," stated Dhanush. "Amit ji has done unbelievable work," said Dhanush.

112.title: Nawab Malik's ED custody extended till March 7 in money laundering case
112.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has been granted additional custody of Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik till March 7 by a PMLA court. The NCP leader was arrested in connection with a money laundering case linked to gangster Dawood Ibrahim. He has claimed that ED is acting against him out of political vendetta as he has been critical of the central government.

113.title: Priyanka lights diya while offering prayers in Varanasi, video surfaces
113.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra offered prayers on the banks of the Ganga river in Varanasi. In a video that has surfaced on social media, she can be seen lighting a 'diya' and offering it in the Ganga river. Priyanka reached Kabir Chaura Math in Varanasi on Thursday and she is expected to stay there for the next three days.

114.title: Tigress rescued from tiger reserve dies during treatment at Bilaspur Zoo
114.article_body: A 13-year-old tigress died during treatment in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur district on Wednesday, a forest official said. The tigress was rescued from Achanakmar Tiger Reserve in June last year and was taken to Kanan Pendari Zoological Garden in Bilaspur for treatment. A seven-member committee was formed for her treatment, however, the animal died due to age-related ailments.

115.title: B'luru man poses as software engineer, cheats Raj local of ₹1.76 crore
115.article_body: A man was arrested in Bengaluru for cheating a resident of Rajasthan's Udaipur of ₹1.76 crore, police said. He posed as a software engineer from Apple and told the victim he could get him iPhones at prices 30-40% cheaper than the market. Subsequently, the victim paid him the amount in instalments and got cheated. The accused was brought to Udaipur.

116.title: Gold ornaments worth ₹16 crore seized on Konark express, 4 held
116.article_body: Gold ornaments worth ₹16 crore were seized from Mumbai-Bhubaneswar Konark Express by the Government Railway Police (GRP). Four people were said to have been detained in connection with the incident for interrogation after they failed to produce valid GST documents. Police said the detainees had been travelling with four bags, each containing 8 kg of gold ornaments.

117.title: Sharp dip in COVID-19 cases, 0.7% of global cases from India: Govt
117.article_body: Union Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said on Thursday a sharp decline in COVID-19 cases has been observed and that only 0.7% of global cases are reported in India. "On (an) average around 11,000 COVID-19 cases are reported on a weekly basis in India," he said. The active caseload has also declined to 77,000, the government said.

118.title: Today, music is made for Instagram Reels and that's sad: Salim Merchant
118.article_body: Music composer Salim Merchant said that music today requires social media validation. "Today, music is made for Instagram Reels...Even creators are making music that's pleasing to ears for a short span of time. That's sad," he added. Salim said that he also doesn't find films very exciting nowadays. "I shouldn't be saying it, but it's the truth," he added.

119.title: Should I run away like our seculars surrendered to terrorism?: Vivek
119.article_body: Talking about the release of his upcoming film 'The Kashmir Files' clashing with Prabhas-starrer 'Radhe Shyam', director Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "Should I...run away like our...seculars..., intellectuals surrendered to terrorism in case of Kashmir Genocide?" "Should I surrender to the might? Whenever I release 'The Kashmir Files' a...star based, hyped up film will release alongside," added Vivek.

120.title: Siraj can bowl long overs, he has shown he can bowl tough overs: Agarkar
120.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar has said pacer Mohammed Siraj is someone who can bowl the "long overs" for the team in Tests. "Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Shami are back...[but] whether in England or at times in South Africa, Siraj has shown that he can bowl the tough overs," Agarkar added. So far, Siraj has picked 36 wickets in 12 Tests.

121.title: Palihapitiya accused of insider sale of Virgin Galactic shares worth $315 mn
121.article_body: Former Virgin Galactic Chairman Chamath Palihapitiya has been accused of selling 10 million of firm's shares for $315 million by leveraging his position before quitting. The lawsuit also alleges Founder Richard Branson nabbed $301 million by selling shares while stock price was "artificially inflated". The suit was filed on behalf of Virgin Galactic to seek damages from directors and officers.

122.title: BSF seizes silver worth ₹2 lakh from farmer on Indo-Bangladesh border
122.article_body: The BSF seized silver balls worth ₹2 lakh from a suspected farmer on the Indo-Bangladesh border on Tuesday. The discovery was made after a soldier on duty saw a suspicious person carrying some luggage on cycle and stopped the person to search the goods. An FIR was lodged against the suspect, identified as Rabban Sheikh, at Lalgola Police Station.

123.title: This is the spirit in which foreign policy should be run: Tharoor on meet with Jaishankar
123.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Thursday praised External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar for a "comprehensive briefing" on the evacuation of Indians from war-torn Ukraine. "This is the spirit in which foreign policy should be run," Tharoor tweeted after the meeting. Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi were also part of the meeting that discussed Russia-Ukraine crisis.

124.title: It won't make a difference: Gavaskar on Bumrah's inexperience in home Tests
124.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar, on being asked if Jasprit Bumrah's inexperience at home will affect his performance in Sri Lanka Tests, said Bumrah is too good a bowler and it won't make a difference. So far, Bumrah has played only two of his 27 Tests on home soil. "Any kind of conditions, he will get you wickets anytime," Gavaskar added.

125.title: Kohli used to be a chubby guy who would eat anything: Harbhajan
125.article_body: Terming Virat Kohli's will to succeed as "unbelievable", Harbhajan Singh said Kohli brought about a transformation in Team India's fitness culture having earlier been a "chubby guy" who would eat "anything and everything". "After a few years when I saw him, he was totally a different guy, knowing...what he wants to do, what is good for him," added Harbhajan.

126.title: Fire breaks out in Zakaria Industrial Estate in Mumbai's Byculla
126.article_body: A fire reportedly broke out in the Zakaria Industrial Estate of Byculla in Mumbai on Thursday. As many as eight fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the fire. As per the officials, firefighting operations were immediately launched. The cause that led to the fire has, however, not yet been determined.

127.title: Multi-crore inland waterway project to be developed in Mizoram
127.article_body: An inland waterway transport project will be developed across a 23-km stretch of Khawthlangtuipui-Tuichawng rivers in Mizoram, an official said. The project, estimated to cost ₹22.93 crore, will cater to the needs of the southern districts. "We must optimally utilise our rivers as economic, swift and ecologically sound means of transport," Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal said on Wednesday.

128.title: Gurugram to get 90 smart signals to ease traffic flow: GMDA officials
128.article_body: The Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority (GMDA) has started working on a project to convert 90 traffic signals in the city to smart signals to ease traffic flow, officials said on Wednesday. The authority has already issued tenders for the project and the work will begin within the next two months, officials added.

129.title: I never thought I will play 100 Test matches, God has been kind: Virat Kohli
129.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli, who will feature in his 100th Test starting tomorrow, said that he never thought he will play 100 Test matches. "It has been a long journey...I am just grateful that I have been able to make it to 100. God has been kind," he said. Kohli has scored 7,962 runs in 99 Tests.

130.title: Irfan Pathan congratulates Kohli on 100th Test, calls him 'magical physio'
130.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Instagram to congratulate Virat Kohli, who will feature in his 100th Test for India tomorrow. "Test cricket was limping & that's when it found a magical physio in Kohli. He came, he conquered & he made everyone love Test cricket all over again! Congratulations on your remarkable achievement," Irfan wrote.

131.title: Tesla German Gigafactory approval decision to be declared tomorrow
131.article_body: The German state of Brandenburg will be announcing its decision on approval for the planned Tesla Gigafactory near Berlin in a news conference on Friday. "The approval procedure for the e-car and battery factory of...Tesla in Gruenheide in Brandenburg is nearing completion," the state government said. Earlier, reports had said Tesla had won final approval from the state environment office.

132.title: Who is Viktor Yanukovych, who may be Russia's pick for Ukraine President after war?
132.article_body: Russia is reportedly backing exiled former Ukraine President Viktor Yanukovych to take charge if the current regime falls. Yanukovych came to power in 2010 but was overthrown after violent protests in 2014. Protests erupted after he refused to sign a trade deal with EU as he sought closer ties with Russia. He had escaped to Russia, allegedly with Russian help.

133.title: How can Indian investors trade in US stocks like Tesla through NSE IFSC?
133.article_body: Indian retail investors will be able to trade in eight US stocks, including Tesla, through NSE IFSC platform from today. The platform's market makers will buy shares in US and issue receipts against them to investors. The receipts, issued at low costs, will represent a fraction of the value of shares. Trading in receipts will take place in US dollars.

134.title: 249 students from Himachal still stuck in Ukraine: CM Jai Ram Thakur
134.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur on Thursday said that 249 students from the state are still stranded in war-torn Ukraine and that the efforts were being made at war-footing to evacuate them to neighbouring countries. "The parents of 163 students have been contacted," he said. Thakur thanked PM Narendra Modi for roping in Indian Air Force for evacuation.

135.title: YouTube's creators contributed ₹6,800 cr to Indian GDP in 2020: Report
135.article_body: Google-owned YouTube on Thursday said its creator ecosystem in India contributed ₹6,800 crore to India's GDP and supported an equivalent of 6,83,900 full-time jobs in the country in 2020. YouTube cited an Oxford Economics report while sharing the company's economic impact in India. "Impact [of our creators, artists] on the economy's overall success will only continue to accelerate," YouTube said.

136.title: 3,726 Indians to return from Ukraine today: Union Minister Scindia
136.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Thursday said 3,726 Indians will be brought back home on Thursday. "With all hands on deck and the direction of PM Narendra Modi ji, we will get 3,726 of our people back home today," Scindia said. Eight flights are scheduled from Bucharest, two from Suceava, one from Kosice, five from Budapest and three from Rzeszow.

137.title: I don't do the PR looks actors do; don't feel the need to be seen: Abhimanyu
137.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree's son, actor Abhimanyu Dassani said he's quite content with the pace of his career and doesn't get bothered by the pace of other actors' careers. He added, "I don't feel the need to be seen. That's why you...don't see me doing the PR looks people do." Abhimanyu said as an actor he'd just like to do "good work".

138.title: From one self-made actor: Yami thanks Kangana for praising her in A Thursday
138.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actress Yami Gautam thanked Kangana Ranaut after she praised her for 'A Thursday'. On Wednesday, Kangana shared a poster of the film featuring Yami on her Instagram Stories, and wrote "Congratulations to Team...@yamigautam." Yami shared Kangana's post, and wrote, "Thank you Kangana. Means a lot, especially when it comes from one self-made actor to another."

139.title: BJP workers hit my car with sticks in Varanasi, told me to go back: Mamata
139.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday alleged that yesterday, during her visit to Varanasi, some BJP workers hit her car with sticks and asked her to go back. "Yesterday, when I was going to ghat from the airport, I saw some BJP workers...Stopping my vehicle. They hit my car with sticks and told me to go back," Banerjee added.

140.title: Ukrainian diplomats in Russia moved to Latvia amid war
140.article_body: Ukrainian diplomats in Moscow have been moved to Latvia amid the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. The diplomats had left Moscow and crossed the Latvian-Russian border on Wednesday night, Latvia's Foreign Minister Edgars Rinkevics tweeted on Thursday. Latvia, last week, had said that it would give refuge to the diplomats after receiving their plea for help.

141.title: Massive landslide blocks Jammu-Srinagar National Highway
141.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Traffic Police on Thursday morning informed that a massive landslide near Banihal town in Ramban district of the state has blocked the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway. Vehicular movement on the highway has, thus, been suspended, the traffic police added. A video showing boulders tumbling down the hill at the Shabanbas area on the highway was shared by ANI.

142.title: Russian soldiers are 'confused children who have been used': Ukraine President
142.article_body: In a video address to the nation, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called on Russian soldiers to "go home", and described them as "confused children who have been used". Zelenskyy also asked Ukrainians to keep up their resistance. His comments came as Russia acknowledged for the first time since the start of invasion that nearly 500 Russian troops have been killed.

143.title: Chinese company Huawei accused of tax evasion in India: Report
143.article_body: A tax investigation on China's Huawei Technologies allegedly found that the telecoms equipment maker manipulated account books to reduce its taxable income in India, Reuters reported citing a government source. On Thursday, the Finance Ministry said that a "major telecom group" did not account for income of ₹400 crore in its books and couldn't justify expenses of ₹480 crore.

144.title: Will explore all options to restore OBC quota for local polls: Maha Min
144.article_body: Speaking on restoration of Other Backward Class (OBC) quota in the local bodies' elections, Maharashtra OBC welfare minister Vijay Wadettiwar said that the state government will discuss the matter and explore all options to restore it. This comes after BJP alleged that the state government did not properly study the report prepared by MSBCC before submitting it to Supreme Court.

145.title: Sarpanch nominee digs up roads, damages street lights after losing in Odisha
145.article_body: Upset over his defeat in elections, a sarpanch candidate in Odisha's Gajapati district allegedly dug up roads and damaged street lights on Monday. Barik Sabar had lost to Haribandhu Karjee in Gangabada panchayat of the district. He along with his supporters reportedly damaged the road near Badadebula village and put stones on the way, thus, blocking communication with five villages.

146.title: Don't kick out Chelsea's owner Abramovich from English football: Neville
146.article_body: Talking about Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich who's been termed one of Vladimir Putin's closest friends by Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss, ex-Manchester United player Gary Neville said Abramovich shouldn't be "kicked" out of English football. Abramovich has announced his decision to sell Chelsea with net proceeds from the sale set to be donated to "victims of the war in Ukraine".

147.title: Naveen's death a reflection of NEET's shameless face: Kumaraswamy
147.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy said that the tragic death of Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar in Ukraine is a reflection of the NEET's "shameless face". NEET is causing injustice to talented but economically vulnerable rural students in the guise of qualification, he added. The youngster's death has made India question its "self-conscience", he further said.

148.title: India's COVID-19 death toll suspect, says Chidambaram citing Science journal
148.article_body: Citing the academic journal Science, Congress leader P Chidambaram said the official number of deaths due to COVID-19 in India is suspect. "The COVID-19 toll in India between 1/6/2020 and 1/7/2021 was 32,00,000, eight times the official toll of 4,00,000," Chidambaram tweeted. "Government’s figures suggest that the average number of deaths per village was less than one! Unbelievable!" he added.

149.title: Audio streaming platform Pocket FM raises $65 million in funding
149.article_body: Audio streaming platform Pocket FM announced it has raised $65 million in its Series C round of funding. The round was led by Goodwater Capital, Naver and existing investor Tanglin Venture Partners. Founded in 2018 by Rohan Nayak, Nishanth Srinivas and Prateek Dixit, Pocket FM offers content in Hindi, Bengali and Tamil. It had raised $22.4 million in December.

150.title: Meerut jeweller dies by suicide over ₹3 crore debt: Police
150.article_body: A 45-year-old jeweller, reeling under a debt of ₹3 crore, has died by suicide in Meerut, police said. His body was found at his residence in the Thatherwada area of the city. Apart from debt, a dispute with his wife and brother forced the deceased to end his life, police added. Meanwhile, his brother has alleged foul play suspecting murder.

151.title: Would go with Vihari over Shubman as he hasn't made any mistake: Jaffer
151.article_body: With Cheteshwar Pujara dropped from India Test squad, Wasim Jaffer said he would go with Hanuma Vihari over Shubman Gill at the number three position as Vihari hasn't made any mistake to miss out. Jaffer added that Vihari hasn't got "many" chances after his 259-ball 62*-run partnership with Ravichandran Ashwin, in the Sydney Test of India's 2020-21 series against Australia.

152.title: Idea of 'nuclear war' spinning in Western politicians' heads: Russia
152.article_body: Amid war between Russia and Ukraine, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said, "It's in the heads of Western politicians that the idea of a nuclear war is spinning constantly and not in the heads of Russians." This comes a day after Lavrov said that if World War 3 takes place, it would involve nuclear weapons and be destructive.

153.title: Producers will be in shock: Prabhas on low cap on movie ticket prices
153.article_body: Discussing the decision by the Andhra Pradesh government to place a low cap on the prices of movie tickets, actor Prabhas said producers of films like his movie 'Radhe Shyam' will be in "shock". "It takes away 40-50 percent of business so it's a big loss," added Prabhas. Prabhas is known for acting in the 'Baahubali' film franchise.

154.title: Won't be easy for whoever comes in place of Rahane, Pujara: Rohit
154.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has said it won't be easy to fill the shoes of veteran batters Cheteshwar Pujara and Ajinkya Rahane, who have been dropped from the squad for Sri Lanka Tests. He added, "What they've done for this team, you can't put it out in words." Rohit further said, "It's not written...that they won't be considered [in future]."

155.title: UP people want Yogi, not ones who build palaces, buy cars: Ravi Kishan
155.article_body: BJP MP Ravi Kishan has said that UP people would vote for CM Yogi Adityanath in the ongoing elections as he's an "educated man and living a monk's life". Kishan said people don't want ones "who want to decorate their palaces and buy fancy cars". He said this in an apparent reference to SP's Akhilesh Yadav and BSP supremo Mayawati.

156.title: Laughed, cried during narration; agreed on spot: Ranveer on 'Jayeshbhai...'
156.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said that he was "laughing through tears" during the narration of 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'. "I had a tissue box kept on the table which got over by the end of the narration. I was entertained, moved," he said, adding, "I agreed then and there on the spot to be a part of this film."

157.title: 4 IAF aircraft evacuate 798 Indians from Romania, Hungary, Poland
157.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) on Thursday said four IAF C-17 aircraft have evacuated a total of 798 Indian nationals stranded in Ukraine using airfields in Romania, Hungary and Poland. IAF added that the aircraft also supplied 9.7 tons of relief material. Additionally, three more C-17 aircraft have taken off for the three countries to bring back remaining Indian nationals.

158.title: Netflix co-CEO announces $1 mn donation towards Ukraine relief
158.article_body: Netflix Co-founder and co-CEO Reed Hastings has announced a $1 million donation to an organisation providing emergency relief to Ukraine. In his tweet announcing the donation, Hastings thanked Russian-born Evgeny Afineevsky, who directed the Oscar-nominated documentary 'Winter on Fire: Ukraine's Fight for Freedom' for Netflix in 2015. Netflix has reportedly suspended all future projects in Russia.

159.title: Govt dismisses report claiming 19 lakh kids lost parent to COVID-19
159.article_body: The Ministry of Women and Child Development has dismissed a study by Lancet, which claimed that 19 lakh children in India lost a parent or caregiver to COVID-19. "These findings have no correlation with ground reality in India as reflected from field findings," the ministry said. It added the number of children affected by COVID-19 in India stands at 1,53,827.

160.title: Nobody is asking correct questions, says Rohit during press conference; video viral
160.article_body: A video of India captain Rohit Sharma saying, "Nobody is asking correct questions" during a press conference went viral. A reporter asked him whether first Test against Sri Lanka is going to be played on outfield as he wasn't talking about pitch. "Nobody is asking me questions related to crowd, pitch, team combination. It's good for me actually," Rohit joked.

161.title: I am perceived as a bully, vulture in the TV industry: Urvashi Dholakia
161.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia said she is perceived as a "vulture" and too strong-headed like a "bully" in the television industry, adding that there are a "lot" of people who have not appreciated her. "I have just been a woman who has her own opinions. Whether you like it or you don't, that's not my problem," stated Urvashi.

162.title: Kohli keeps track of the performances of every RCB player: Shahbaz
162.article_body: Talking about former RCB captain Virat Kohli, RCB player Shahbaz Ahmed said Kohli keeps track of the performances of every player in the franchise, adding that he shares his feedback at times as well. "Kohli is a bowler's captain. He supports bowlers massively," stated Shahbaz who was signed by RCB for ₹2.4 crore in the mega auction.

163.title: Man lures 16-yr-old girl for car ride, rapes her in vehicle in Gurugram
163.article_body: A man allegedly lured a 16-year-old girl on the pretext of giving her a ride in his car and later raped her inside the vehicle in Gurugram late Tuesday night, police said. The girl's mother had filed a missing complaint about her, following which the police launched a search operation and found her. Subsequently, police registered a case of rape.

164.title: US baby becomes 1 of 100 people in the world diagnosed with 'Uncombable Hair Syndrome'
164.article_body: A mother from US' Georgia has taken to Instagram to raise awareness about her one-year-old son Locklan Samples' rare genetic condition called Uncombable Hair Syndrome (UHS). Locklan, nicknamed Lock by his parents, is one of the 100 confirmed cases of Uncombable Hair Syndrome in the world. This genetic condition affects children from the age of three months to 12 years.

165.title: Taiwan invasion is next, China's Xi is watching with glee: Trump on Russia-Ukraine war
165.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine war, former US President Donald Trump said, "Taiwan is going to be next. Just watch Taiwan. [Chinese] President Xi is watching with glee." "President Xi happens to be a man with a high intelligence level...He saw the way that we left Afghanistan..and this is his opportunity to do what he wants to do," he added.

166.title: Kohli has a better cover drive and technique than Babar: Brett Lee
166.article_body: Brett Lee said Virat Kohli is one of the three players who have a "better" technique and cover drive than Babar Azam, with the other two being Joe Root and Kane Williamson. Lee added that Babar will be Australia's "biggest" threat during the tour of Pakistan. "You have to get Babar out early. That's...Australia's greatest way to win," stated Lee.

167.title: Traffic to be diverted in Hyd for Vice Prez Naidu's visit on March 4
167.article_body: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu will visit Hyderabad on March 4 (Friday) and in view of this, the traffic is expected to either be stopped or diverted from Begumpet to Jubilee Hills. The route where the traffic might be stopped or diverted includes PNT Flyover, Shyam Lal building, HPS Begumpet, Begumpet Flyover and Punjagutta Flyover, the Telangana Police said.

168.title: Ukraine seizes secret battle plans left behind by Russian troops; shares pics
168.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry said, "Russian occupiers are losing not only equipment and manpower...In panic attacks, they are leaving classified documents." It claimed Ukraine's forces have gained access to classified planning documents of the Russian Navy's Black Sea Fleet. Ukraine said the documents included a working map, operational order, tables of call signs, signals and a list of personnel.

169.title: Amazon gods will have to come down to talk to us mortals: Future Retail in SC
169.article_body: Amazon's counsel on Thursday in the Supreme Court proposed talks with Future Retail and Reliance to end months-long legal battles between the companies. After Amazon's proposal, advocate Harish Salve, representing Future Retail said, "Amazon gods will have to come down to talk to us mortals." He asked, "What is preventing Amazon's boss from calling up Biyanis (Future Group's Kishore Biyani)?"

170.title: Japanese discount store operator to support 100 Ukrainian refugee families
170.article_body: Japan's Pan Pacific International, which operates a major discount store chain, said it would support 100 Ukrainian families approved by the Japanese government to enter the country as refugees. The company will provide financial support and job opportunities for refugee families, it added. The Japanese government has not yet specified how many refugees it would accept from Ukraine.

171.title: Ukrainians can get visas on arrival: UAE after reports of tightening norms
171.article_body: The UAE has said that Ukrainians will continue to be eligible for visas on arrival in the country. This comes after Kyiv's embassy in the Gulf Arab state, without offering a reason, said that visa waiver for Ukrainian citizens has been temporarily suspended. Notably, lakhs of Ukrainians have reportedly fled their country after the Russian attack.

172.title: UK rejects Russian demand to sell stake in Bharti Global co-led OneWeb
172.article_body: The UK has rejected Russia's demand for it to sell its stake in satellite firm OneWeb to allow a satellite launch. "There's no negotiation on OneWeb: the UK government is not selling its share," UK Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng said. OneWeb was bought by the UK government and India's Bharti Global in a bankruptcy rescue deal in 2020.

173.title: Taiwan faces massive blackout; outage hits around 55 lakh homes
173.article_body: Taiwan faced a massive blackout on Thursday reportedly due to a malfunction at a power plant in southern Kaohsiung city, which subsequently led to the failure of an ultra-high voltage station in neighbouring Tainan. State-run power firm Taipower said that the outage hit around 55 lakh homes, adding that power was restored in about 40 lakh of those.

174.title: 4 including head chef, waiter killed as car hits motorcycles in Gurugram
174.article_body: Four employees of a restaurant in Qutub Plaza in Gurugram, including a head chef, a waiter, a cleaner and a delivery boy, died after a speeding Skoda car allegedly rammed into their motorcycles on Wednesday.
