Police said driver of car was drunk. The deceased have been identified as Jitendra Mandal, Rajnish Mandal, Gopal Singh and Govind Kumar.

175.title: My main concern is regarding Ashwin's fitness for 1st Sri Lanka Test: Ojha
175.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha has expressed concern over spinner Ravichandran Ashwin's fitness ahead of the first Test against Sri Lanka. "Ashwin's absence could prove to be a big factor. If he's fit, then good but if he's not, then who will Team India play instead of him?" asked Ojha. Ashwin missed the West Indies series due to an unknown injury.

176.title: My 1st thought was 'I can't', 2nd was 'I won't': Rohit on playing Ambedkar
176.article_body: Actor Rohit Roy, while talking about playing BR Ambedkar in grand musical 'Babasaheb', said his first thought was 'I can't do it' and second was 'I won't do it'. "How do you prepare for a role like this in ten days? I read script for second time...I thought I have to do this...it is once in lifetime opportunity," he added.

177.title: BJP fighting for its existence in UP Assembly polls: SBSP chief
177.article_body: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief OP Rajbhar on Thursday said, "The BJP is fighting for its existence in this election." He also said that BJP won't be able to even cross the double-figure in eastern Uttar Pradesh. "In the assembly constituencies of Ballia, Mau, Azamgarh, Ambedkar Nagar and Ghazipur, BJP won't be able to open its account," he added.

178.title: PM will be shown black flags during his Pune visit on March 6: Cong
178.article_body: Pune Congress has planned to show black flags to PM Narendra Modi during his visit to the city on March 6 for his remarks on Maharashtra in Parliament, Pune Congress chief Ramesh Bagwe said. He added that the party has taken permission from police. PM Modi had stated that Maharashtra had encouraged the spread of COVID-19 in other states.

179.title: Provide specific reservation for transgenders: Madras HC to TN govt
179.article_body: The Madras HC recommended to the Tamil Nadu government to provide a specified percentage of special reservations for the Transgenders/Third Gender (TG) in future public employments, apart from other relaxations extended to the socially and economically backward classes. Justice MS Ramesh made the recommendation while allowing a batch of writ petitions from Saratha, a TG, and seven others.

180.title: I was in hospital 3 days before participating in Miss Universe: Harnaaz Sandhu
180.article_body: Miss Universe 2021, Harnaaz Sandhu, said she did not imagine being the crown holder and wasn't ready to participate in contest. "It was my mother who said that you need to participate this year. I was in hospital for three days before participating. I learnt about my celiac disease, that I am allergic to gluten. I didn't know," she said.

181.title: Have united with SP to oust BJP from Uttar Pradesh: Shivpal Yadav
181.article_body: Speaking on forming an alliance with SP for the UP Assembly elections, Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party chief Shivpal Yadav said that he has united with nephew Akhilesh Yadav to ensure the ouster of the BJP government in UP. "When I had started touring the state, there was only one demand from you all that 'chacha-bhatija' should unite," Shivpal said.

182.title: I'm not scared: WB CM on being stopped by BJP workers in Varanasi
182.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said she is "not a coward...[and is] not scared" as BJP's "loss is imminent". This comes after "BJP workers" stopped her vehicle enroute to a SP-led rally in Varanasi. "They hit my car with sticks and told me to go back...I got down...and faced them to see what they can do," Banerjee added.

183.title: Every Haryana district to get a 200-bed hospital: Governor Dattatreya
183.article_body: Haryana Governor Bandaru Dattatreya on Wednesday announced that 200-bed hospitals will be opened in every district in the state. "The state government has [also] proposed to set up a medical college in every district," he added. Governor Dattatreya further said that government medical colleges are being set up in Bhiwani, Jind, Mahendragarh, Kaithal, Sirsa and Yamunanagar districts.

184.title: 'What the hell was that?', says reporter as explosions light up Kyiv skyline on live TV
184.article_body: Massive explosions in Ukraine's capital Kyiv in the early hours of Thursday were caught on camera just as a reporter was recording a video. CBS News' Charlie D'Agata was coming off the air when the sky lit up behind him "almost like lightning" and explosions were heard. "What the hell was that?" the reporter can be heard saying.

185.title: 175 nations agree to legally-binding UN treaty to end plastic pollution
185.article_body: In all, 175 countries have agreed to forge an international legally-binding agreement by 2024 to end plastic pollution at United Nations Environment Assembly on Wednesday. The treaty has been hailed as a "triumph by planet earth over single-use plastics" by UN's Inger Andersen. It would tackle plastic at different levels in its life cycle, including production, design and disposal.

186.title: BJP took donations from Bombay bomb blasts accused Memon's firm: NCP MLA
186.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) MLA Anil Gote alleged that former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis and BJP took ₹20 crore from RKW Developers Limited and other developers with alleged links with late Iqbal Memon after 2014. Memon was accused in the 1993 Bombay bomb blasts. Gote, a former BJP MLA, filed a complaint against BJP and Fadnavis with Enforcement Directorate.

187.title: TN govt sets up one-member panel to probe Smart City irregularities
187.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Wednesday formed a committee to look into the implementation of the Smart City project in the state. The one-member panel comprising retired IAS officer PWC Davidar will inquire whether projects were implemented in accordance with the guidelines. It will also check whether government grants were released and utilised as per guidelines, among other irregularities.

188.title: Ukraine-born Russian millionaire found hanging in his £18-million UK mansion
188.article_body: Ukraine-born Russian millionaire Mikhail Watford was allegedly found hanging by his gardener in his £18-million mansion in UK's Surrey. "His state of mind might have been affected by the situation in the Ukraine. The timing of his death and the invasion...was surely not coincidental," his friend said. The 66-year-old's name wasn't on the list of people sanctioned by UK government.

189.title: Reports on Chinese-Russian coordination on Ukraine are fake: China
189.article_body: Chinese Foreign Ministry said reports on Chinese and Russian coordination ahead of Russia's attack on Ukraine are "fake news". Such practices of diverting attention and shifting blame are "despicable", it added. This comes after The New York Times, citing US officials, reported that Chinese officials had asked Russian officials to delay the invasion of Ukraine until after Beijing Olympics ended.

190.title: Goa to resume economic activities with 100% capacity, says CM
190.article_body: The Chief Minister of Goa, Pramod Sawant, informed that the expert committee has advised resuming all the economic activities with 100% capacity in the state following a drop in the COVID-19 cases. "The government will take the decision by tomorrow & will resume the activities including casinos," the CM added. As of Wednesday, there were 209 active cases in Goa.

191.title: Pune's Aundh-Baner saw most suspected dengue cases between Jan-Feb
191.article_body: Aundh-Baner ward in Pune reported the highest number of suspected dengue cases in the city at 28 between January 1 and February 25. The city had reported a total of 272 suspected cases of dengue in this period. Keshavnagar had the lowest suspected cases at three, while no cases were reported from Warje-Karvenagar and Kondhwa-Yewalewadi.

192.title: Man kills friend for not returning ₹30,000 he borrowed in Navi Mumbai
192.article_body: A 21-year-old man, identified as Jai Shankar Umesh Prasad, was arrested on Tuesday by Navi Mumbai Police for allegedly stabbing his 45-year-old colleague and friend with a screwdriver after the deceased failed to return ₹30,000 he had borrowed. On Monday, the duo had an argument after which Prasad stabbed him. He was nabbed when he tried to flee to Bihar.

193.title: B'luru International Film Festival begins; 200 films to be screened
193.article_body: The 13th edition of the Bengaluru International Film Festival (BIFFES) has started today. During the festival, which will be held till March 10, more than 200 films from around 55 countries will be screened at three locations, including Orion Mall's PVR Cinemas, in Bengaluru. BIFFES will also pay tribute to late actor Puneeth Rajkumar and will screen his three films.

194.title: MHA approves formation of Village Defence Groups in J&K
194.article_body: Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has approved the formation of Village Defence Groups (VDG) in Jammu and Kashmir. As per the revised scheme, persons leading the group in more vulnerable areas will receive ₹4,500 per month while other volunteers will receive ₹4,000 per month. The VDGs will function under the SP or SSP of the concerned district, the order said.

195.title: Man arrested for raping & torturing daughter for 3 yrs in Mumbai
195.article_body: A 50-year-old rickshaw driver was arrested by Mumbai Police on Tuesday for allegedly raping and torturing his 22-year-old daughter since 2019. The victim's mother was booked as she allegedly inflicted burn injuries on her. He impregnated her but she was allegedly given pills for abortion by her mother. A probe is underway to know if he raped his other daughter.

196.title: Don't judge Russians by one person's decision: Leysan on Russia-Ukraine crisis
196.article_body: Actress Leysan Karimova, who's currently in India, is worried about her family in Russia amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. She said, "My condolences to all people who lost their families...For me, Russians and Ukrainians, [are] all brothers and sisters, I don't see any difference between these two nationalities." "Please don't judge the whole nation by [one person's decision]," she added.

197.title: One hell of a ride, we want to make it special for him: Rohit on Kohli's 100th Test
197.article_body: On the eve of India-Sri Lanka Test which will mark Virat Kohli's 100th Test match, India captain Rohit Sharma said, "It has been one hell of a ride for him and it will continue to be in the coming years." Rohit added, "We definitely want to make it special for him, let’s hope we have good five days of cricket."

198.title: I was cleaner than Monica from 'Friends': Courteney on being 'clean freak'
198.article_body: Actress Courteney Cox said that she is a clean freak and that she was "a little" cleaner than the character of Monica that she played in the show 'Friends'. "Well, I think that I wasn't typecast, but maybe a little bit. I think that I added to the cleanliness of Monica, she was very competitive," she said.

199.title: HC orders Andhra Pradesh govt to develop Amaravati as capital city
199.article_body: Andhra Pradesh High Court on Thursday ordered the Andhra Pradesh government to develop Amaravati as the state's capital and to not use the 33,000 acres of land pooled from farmers. HC also ordered to hand over developed plots to farmers in three months. The state government was planning to dump the Greenfield capital city project and instead build three capitals.

200.title: Maharashtra government is dedicated to Dawood: Fadnavis
200.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis, who has been calling for state minister Nawab Malik’s resignation, said the latter has been arrested but his resignation has not been taken yet. "This is a Dawood (Ibrahim) samarpit (dedicated), Dawood sharan government. This government (MVA) is coming together to save people who keep relations with Dawood," Fadnavis added.

201.title: You can do better NYT: Serena as paper prints her sister's pic in story about her
201.article_body: Tennis player Serena Williams tweeted, "You can do better, The New York Times," (NYT) after the newspaper wrongly published her sister Venus Williams' photo instead of her in a story. The story was about Serena raising $111 million for her new early-stage venture capital firm. "No matter how far we come, we get reminded that it's not enough," she added.

202.title: Oil soars to highest since 2008, hits $116/barrel as Russia invades Ukraine
202.article_body: Oil prices soared to $116 a barrel on Thursday, the highest level since 2008, as buyers continued to reject Russian crude following its invasion of Ukraine. The invasion has sparked supply concerns across commodity markets from energy to grains. Meanwhile, the OPEC+ has stuck with the 4,00,000 barrel-a-day production increase that was scheduled for April.

203.title: Illustration shows PM Modi submerged in water & acting as bridge for Indians in Ukraine
203.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal shared an illustration on India's evacuation efforts in Ukraine. It shows PM Narendra Modi half submerged in water as Indian citizens climbed on him to cross the water. Citizens of Pakistan, China and US are seen shouting for help while caricatures of their leaders peek out from walls. "PM...Modi ji, India's 'Bridge of Hope'," wrote Goyal.

204.title: Indian family of 4 post video seeking help from Ukraine, say 'unable to get out of Kyiv'
204.article_body: An Indian family stuck in Ukraine has posted a video online, seeking help from Indian Embassy for evacuation. "We are a family of four. Myself Dr Rajkumar Santhalani...and my son...is having fever, and we are unable to get out of Kyiv," Santhalani said in the video. This comes after the government said that no Indians are left in Kyiv.

205.title: 4 car thieves try to run over police personnel in Delhi, arrested
205.article_body: Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested four thieves, involved in stealing cars, as they tried to run over two police personnel near the IIT Metro Station. They were booked on the charge of attempt to murder, police said. One of the accused, who was driving a stolen car, lost control and rammed into a tree, police added.

206.title: Housing society in Greater Noida fined ₹1 crore for water pollution
206.article_body: The Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) imposed a fine of ₹1 crore on Supertech's Eco Village-1 society for dumping untreated sewerage into a rainwater drain in violation of norms. So far, this is the biggest penalty amount imposed by GNIDA for water pollution. The authority has asked the developer to remit the fine amount within a week, officials said.

207.title: UK couple paint their house in colours of Ukraine flag to show solidarity
207.article_body: A UK couple, Rend and Michael Platings, has painted their house in the colours of the Ukraine flag to show their support for the country. "We've got friends in Ukraine, they're really lovely people, very brave...We just wanted to...let them know we're not forgetting about them," Michael said. The couple said they believe "Russia has been the aggressor, the bully".

208.title: IMD predicts heavy to very heavy rain in Tamil Nadu, Puducherry
208.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted heavy to very heavy rainfall in parts of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry due to a low-pressure area over central parts of south Bay of Bengal. The system is likely to intensify into a deep depression and is most likely to head towards north Tamil Nadu during the next 48 hours, IMD said.

209.title: CISF personnel who joined duty after break kills self at Chennai airport
209.article_body: A Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel died by suicide in the washroom of the Chennai Airport on Thursday. The 27-year-old personnel had joined duty after a break. "The incident happened around 07:15 am, one of the housekeeping staff checked restroom around...07:30 am and alerted the officials...a doctor immediately rushed to area...and declared him dead," an airport official said.

210.title: Full assault on truth: US accuses Russia of blocking independent news outlets
210.article_body: The US has accused Russia of launching a "full assault on media freedom and the truth" by blocking independent news outlets and preventing Russians from hearing news of the invasion of Ukraine. "Russia's government is also throttling Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram platforms that tens of millions of Russians...rely on to access independent information and opinions," US State Department said.

211.title: Best thing that could've happened to me: Julia Fox on dating ex-boyfriend Kanye
211.article_body: Speaking about her relationship with her ex-boyfriend, Kanye West, Julia Fox said that it was the "best thing" that could have happened to her. Julia added that being together with Kanye was like hitting a reset button. "It kind of brought a spark back into my life that I had kind of forgotten about," she said.

212.title: Need to focus on Make In India, manufacture sustainable products: PM
212.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said that the world is looking at India as a manufacturing powerhouse. "We need to focus on Make in India, need to manufacture sustainable and qualitative products," PM Modi added. "We have to become self-reliant in the production of semiconductors. Make in India is the demand of the time," PM Modi stated.

213.title: Amazon, Future Group agree to hold talks to settle 18-month long legal dispute
213.article_body: During a Supreme Court hearing on Thursday, Amazon and Kishore Biyani-led Future Group agreed to initiate talks for an out-of-court settlement of the 18-month long legal dispute between the two. "No one is winning. FRL, Reliance and Amazon all have issues," Future Group's counsel Harish Salve said. The court granted them 10 days to explore settlement.

214.title: Shanaya, Lakshya to make their B'wood debut with Karan Johar's Bedhadak
214.article_body: Actors Lakshya and Shanaya Kapoor will make their Bollywood debut with the upcoming film 'Bedhadak'. The film's producer Karan Johar on Thursday made the announcement on his social media handles. Sharing the first poster of the film featuring Shanaya, Karan Johar wrote, "Introducing the gorgeous Shanaya Kapoor...I can't wait to see the energy she brings onto the screen!"

215.title: Kim Kardashian declared legally single amid divorce with Kanye West
215.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian has been declared legally single amid her divorce with rapper Ye, formerly known as Kanye West. In a virtual court hearing on Wednesday, Kim also officially and legally dropped 'West' from her last name as part of the bifurcated divorce proceedings. Issues of child custody and property are yet to be worked out.

216.title: Student shares sexually explicit morphed pics of university faculty in Punjab, held
216.article_body: Punjab Police have arrested a student for circulating sexually explicit morphed photos of faculty members of a private university. The accused was identified as Mohali resident Navjosh Singh Atwal. Atwal revealed he used to download porn material and then morphed the downloaded video content with photos of faculty members to circulate them by creating fake WhatsApp accounts using VPN.

217.title: Who is Fedorov, Ukraine's youngest minister urging tech firms to act against Russia?
217.article_body: Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov has been calling on big tech companies, including Apple, Google and Meta, to completely isolate Russia amid its invasion of Ukraine. The 31-year-old, who is Ukraine's youngest minister, had managed Volodymyr Zelenskyy's digital campaign in 2019 and it was so successful that Zelenskyy became President, reports said. Prior to politics, he ran a marketing agency.

218.title: China is provoking India at every turn: US diplomat Donald Lu
218.article_body: US' Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asia, Donald Lu, said China is provoking India at every turn just as it is challenging US. Lu cited China selecting the regiment commander responsible for attack on Indian border as torchbearer at Winter Olympics in Beijing. Lu added US is working with India on bolstering its defence capabilities.

219.title: You're counting sips of water before off-shirt scene: Robert on 'The Batman'
219.article_body: 'The Batman' actor Robert Pattinson said "you're counting sips of water" before scenes with "your shirt off". Talking about how he had to watch what he was consuming before shirtless scenes, he said, "You just cut down and cut down and cut down." "I had three months before movie started...then you're working out before...after work all the time," he added.

220.title: Oracle suspends operations in Russia, SAP pauses sales
220.article_body: Oracle said it has suspended all operations in Russia, while SAP announced it will pause all sales, after Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov wrote letters to them requesting to end services to Russia. In response to Fedorov's request, Oracle said it had "already suspended all operations". SAP called sanctions against Russia "an important mechanism" in efforts to restore peace.

221.title: Chahar is slightly ahead of Bhuvneshwar for place in T20 WC squad: Irfan
221.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said pacer Deepak Chahar is slightly ahead of Bhuvneshwar Kumar for a place in India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "Bhuvneshwar has been doing well in the past few games, but when it comes to batting, Chahar has improved a lot. On that basis, I think he's ahead," Irfan explained.

222.title: Maharashtra Guv leaves Assembly midway amid slogan shouting
222.article_body: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari left the Vidhan Bhavan without completing his address to the joint session of the Houses amid slogan-shouting by MLAs. State Minister Jayant Patil claimed that MVA shouted slogans in praise of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, while BJP legislators raised "low level" slogans. The Governor had allegedly made controversial remarks over Shivaji Maharaj recently.

223.title: TIME magazine cover features Zelenskyy's quote, Ukraine calls it 'historic'
223.article_body: TIME magazine unveiled the cover of its upcoming edition. The cover image features the words spoken by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a speech addressed to European Parliament. The quote reads, "Life will win over death, and light will win over darkness." The official Twitter account of war-ridden Ukraine called the cover "historic".

224.title: Man, woman beaten up over alleged love affair in Raj
224.article_body: A man and a married woman were assaulted in Rajasthan's Ukheri over suspected love affair. The complainant alleged he went to a house in the village to ask for water when two men locked him inside. They, later, tied him to a wooden post with a woman present inside the house and beat them up, suspecting an affair between them.

225.title: Mukesh Ambani's $89.9 bn fortune nearly equals Russia's 4 richest men combined
225.article_body: India's richest person and Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani currently has a net worth of $89.9 billion, which is nearly equal to that of Russia's four richest billionaires combined. Russia's richest man Vladimir Potanin has a net worth of $25.2 billion, as per Bloomberg, while Severstal's ex-CEO Alexey Mordashov and Novatek Founder Leonid Mikhelson's fortunes stand at $22 billion each.

226.title: Police seize opium from vehicle registered in NPP MLA’s name in Manipur
226.article_body: Police said around 34 kg of opium was seized by Narcotics and Affairs of Border (NAB) from a vehicle registered in the name of National People's Party's (NPP) MLA Langpoklakpam Jayantakumar Singh in Manipur on Wednesday. The driver of the vehicle was arrested. During interrogation, the accused confessed that he is an inter-state drug trafficker.

227.title: Ukraine explains why it was invaded by Russia
227.article_body: In a post on its official Twitter handle, Ukraine shared a link explaining why it was invaded by Russia. "Russian President Vladimir Putin has spared no effort to promote the false historical narrative that Ukrainians and Russians constitute 'one nation'," Ukraine said. "Putin cannot tolerate core values and DNA of Ukrainian society...so he is seeking to destroy them," Ukraine added.

228.title: Nissan ex-exec gets 6-month suspension for helping ex-CEO hide pay
228.article_body: Former Nissan executive Greg Kelly has been given a six-month suspended sentence for helping former CEO Carlos Ghosn hide pay from financial regulators, in Tokyo. A judge suspended Kelly's sentence for three years in his ruling on Thursday, ending months of trial proceedings. The two executives were arrested in Tokyo in November 2018 and charged with various financial misconduct offences.

229.title: 4 killed, 2 children injured as SUV rams into houses in Andhra Pradesh
229.article_body: Four people were killed and two children sustained injuries when an SUV travelling at a high speed lost control and rammed into their houses in Andhra Pradesh's Kadapa district on Wednesday, police said. The victims were relaxing on their cots in front of their houses, police added. "The children are out of danger...their condition is stable," police further said.

230.title: Don’t let COVID-19 vaccine doses get wasted: Centre writes to states, UTs
230.article_body: The Centre has asked the states and union territories to ensure that COVID-19 vaccine doses do not get wasted in private or government vaccination centres due to expiry. In a letter, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare noted that "earlier also directions have been issued to specific states of West Bengal, Karnataka, Kerala and Maharashtra" in this regard.

231.title: They need outlet: Official on wellness session for Kamathipura sex workers
231.article_body: India Post held wellness session for sex workers of Kamathipura in Mumbai. Session reportedly focused on healthy meals and importance of sharing personal problems. It lasted for over three hours. "They need outlet...A heart-to-heart conversation...I decided to start programme to make them feel comfortable in reaching out to government as they do with NGOs," Postmaster General Swati Pandey said.

232.title: Leopard skin seized during search operation in Odisha, 1 arrested
232.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of the Odisha Police seized leopard skin and arrested one person on Wednesday. The search operation was conducted with the help of Ramgiri forest officials in the Gajapati district, a senior STF official said. "The accused has been detained and handed over to Ramgiri forest officials for necessary legal action," the official added.

233.title: 'The Batman' makers unveil film's special video on Burj Khalifa, video surfaces
233.article_body: The makers of the movie 'The Batman' unveiled a special video of the film on the Burj Khalifa in Dubai. The text in the video said, "It's not just a signal, it's a warning. Unmask the truth." The text was followed by images from the film's trailers. "Our favourite Caped Crusader has taken over #BurjKhalifa," Warner Bros Pictures wrote on Instagram.

234.title: Amazon CEO pledges logistics, cybersecurity support for Ukraine
234.article_body: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy in a tweet pledged the firm's support to Ukraine saying the firm is using its logistics capability to get supplies to those in need and cybersecurity expertise to help governments and companies. "Amazon stands with the people of Ukraine, and will continue to help," he said, calling the situation in Ukraine "deeply concerning".

235.title: What could be better for Kohli's 71st hundred than his 100th Test: Jaffer
235.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that there can't be a better opportunity for Virat Kohli to score his next hundred than the occasion of his 100th Test in Mohali against Sri Lanka. Kohli hasn't scored a century in international cricket since November 2019. "We all are eagerly waiting to see the old Virat," Jaffer added.

236.title: Police to contact ordnance factories to trace explosives found in Gurugram house
236.article_body: The police have decided to contact various ordnance factories in order to trace the origin of explosives found in a vacant house in Gurugram Sector 31. "We will be writing to ordnance factories in Khagaria (MP), Muradnagar (UP) and Sivakasi Fire Factory in Tamil Nadu, which manufacture these kinds of ammunition to identify their probable buyers," the police said.

237.title: Voter turnout will be historic in Purvanchal region: BJP's Ravi Kishan
237.article_body: As polling for the sixth phase of UP Assembly polls began on Thursday, BJP MP from Gorakhpur, Ravi Kishan, said that the voter turnout will be historic in the Purvanchal region. "We will win all nine seats in Gorakhpur mandal…BJP will get over 300 seats," Kishan added. "The people of UP have decided to establish Ram Rajya here," Kishan stated.

238.title: Man punches 7 Asian women in US in span of 2 hours; arrested
238.article_body: New York Police have arrested and charged a man for allegedly punching seven Asian women in separate attacks in the span of just over two hours. The assaults reportedly took place on Sunday night from 6:30 to 8:37 pm in Manhattan. The victims were aged between 19 and 57, and they were attacked without any provocations, police said.

239.title: Vladimir Putin's statue removed from a museum in Paris, pics surface
239.article_body: Grevin Museum in Paris has removed the wax figure of Russian President Vladimir Putin in protest against Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Today it is no longer possible to present a character like him...for the first time in the museum's history we are withdrawing a statue because of historical events currently under way," museum director Yves Delhommeau said.

240.title: I don't talk Hindu-Muslim, our party doesn't discriminate: Rajnath Singh
240.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that BJP doesn't discriminate against people on the basis of caste or religion. "I don't talk about Hindu-Muslims, I don't believe in it. I don't see differences between Hindu, Muslim, Christian, or any religion. Our party doesn't differentiate between people in the name of religion," he said when asked about BJP's alleged anti-minority image.

241.title: Director Milap Zaveri loses 32 kg in less than a year, shares pic
241.article_body: Filmmaker Milap Zaveri lost around 32-kg weight in less than year. He took to Twitter to share a picture of himself and revealed that he now weighs 98.6 kg. In an interview with Hindustan Times, he revealed that he had started his weight loss journey in July last year when he weighed around 130 kg.

242.title: China asked Russia to delay Ukraine invasion until after Olympics: Report
242.article_body: A Western intelligence report indicated that Chinese officials asked Russian officials not to invade Ukraine until after the Beijing Olympics ended, NYT reported citing US officials. However, it didn't indicate that the country's Presidents Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping discussed a possible invasion when they met during Olympics on Feb 4. These claims are "speculations", a Chinese official said.

243.title: EV charging stations in Russia display 'Putin is d***head' as Ukraine firm hacks them
243.article_body: Electric vehicle charging stations on a Russian motorway were hacked by a Ukrainian company with a message reading "Putin is a d***head". "Glory to Ukraine / Glory to the heroes / Death to the enemy," other messages read. The Ukrainian company, that provided parts for the chargers, hacked them using a backdoor in the chargers' control systems.

244.title: 22-yr-old drowns in Gujarat dam while taking selfie, police finds phone with last videos
244.article_body: A 22-year-old man drowned while taking a selfie near Kakrapar dam in Gujarat's Surat district on Tuesday. The deceased was identified as Hitesh Rabari, a native of Banaskantha. Hitesh had gone to Kakrapar dam along with his three friends. Police said the deceased's mobile phone was recovered which contains his selfie videos taken before the incident.

245.title: 12th edition of Bengaluru India Nano to be held from March 7-9
245.article_body: The 12th edition of the three-day-long Bengaluru India Nano event with 'Nanotech for Sustainable Future' as its central theme will be held from March 7-9, said Karnataka Minister Dr Ashwathnarayan CN. Over 10 countries and 2,500 registered delegates will be participating in the summit which will have over 40 companies showcasing its nanotech products, services, and innovation and poster sessions.

246.title: Mumbai Police Commissioner shares personal mobile number on Facebook
246.article_body: In a move to maintain law and order in the city, the newly appointed Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey shared his personal mobile number on Facebook and asked people to contact him directly to share their suggestions. "Suggestions big or small are all welcome...I too will share with you what work we are doing on a weekly basis," he said.

247.title: They started blowing the trumpet: Shantanu on parents' reaction to 'Gangubai...'
247.article_body: When asked about his parents' reaction to his film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', actor Shantanu Maheshwari said, "Honestly, I had just told them that I'm part of the film but [I] didn’t...give much details." "They went to watch the film on Friday, and fir toh dhindora peetne lage (they started blowing the trumpet)...They asked everyone around them to watch it," he added.

248.title: Congress doing politics on Indians stranded in Ukraine: Naqvi
248.article_body: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi criticised Congress for doing "politics" over the issue of Indian citizens stranded in Ukraine. "The government is making constant efforts to bring Indian students from Ukraine. On the other hand, Congress is doing politics in a crisis situation like this," Naqvi added. "It's nothing but stupidity," he stated.

249.title: 15-yr-old student dies after fight with classmates in school in Hyd
249.article_body: A 15-year-old student of class 10 of a private school died on Wednesday after a fight with classmates in Hyderabad, police said. The boy was allegedly hit by two of his classmates following an argument, police added. The victim had allegedly thrown a paper ball on one of his classmates which led to a fight, police further said.

250.title: Army jawan held in Thane for molesting foreign national on express train
250.article_body: An Army jawan has been arrested by railway police in Maharashtra's Thane district for allegedly molesting a foreign national on an express train. The accused has been identified as Sateesh T who hails from Kerala. Sateesh had allegedly molested a Portuguese woman who was travelling in Goa-Nizamuddin Express train between Kalyan and Kasara station in February 2019, the police said.

251.title: MMRDA conducts trial run for 'Make in India' metro rake between Aarey & Kurar
251.article_body: The MMRDA conducted a trial run for the first 'Make in India' metro rake on Phase 1 of Metro Line 7, between Aarey and Kurar, on Wednesday. Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray along with Urban Development Minister Eknath Shinde inspected the work. The metro line will be opened to the public once the MMRDA receives required certifications, an official said.

252.title: Women's team win Air Pistol event to secure India's 2nd gold at shooting WC
252.article_body: India won its second gold medal at the ongoing ISSF Shooting World Cup in Cairo after Esha Singh, P Nivetha and Ruchita Vinerkar won the women's 10 metre Air Pistol team event. The trio defeated Germany's Andrea Katharina Heckner, Sandra Reitz and Carina Wimmer 16-6 for the medal. Earlier, 19-year-old Saurabh Chaudhary won gold in men's 10 metre Air Pistol.

253.title: Journey from watching his films to directing him unbelievable: Nagraj on Big B
253.article_body: 'Jhund' director Nagraj Popatrao Manjule said that the journey of watching actor Amitabh Bachchan's films to directing him has been "unbelievable". "I even became a filmmaker incidentally. My team and I shoot very casually, but since Bachchan sir was around on sets of 'Jhund' while shooting so, we had to be disciplined," he added.

254.title: 148 IAF aircraft to demonstrate capabilities at exercise 'Vayu Shakti' in Pokhran
254.article_body: A total of 148 aircraft of the Indian Air Force (IAF) will demonstrate their full spectrum combat and fire capabilities during exercise 'Vayu Shakti' in Pokhran on March 7. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be the chief guest, a senior IAF official noted. For the first time, Rafale fighter jets will also participate in the exercise, the official added.

255.title: Can we direct Putin to stop war?: CJI as lawyer approaches SC over students' evacuation
255.article_body: After a lawyer approached Supreme Court seeking directions to government for the evacuation of Indian students stranded in Ukraine, a bench headed by Chief Justice of India NV Ramana said, "Government of India is doing its work to evacuate Indians." "We sympathise with the students...But can we direct Russia's President Putin to stop the war?" CJI Ramana said.

256.title: Missile strike on building captured on camera as Ukrainian man takes selfie video
256.article_body: A man in Ukraine's Kharkiv captured the moment when a missile fired by Russian soldiers hit a building. The man was recording a selfie video wherein he was asking for donations. After the missile hit the building, the man ran for safety. In the video, debris can be seen flying across the room he's filming in.

257.title: Tesla, Google, Apple & 5 other US stocks to begin trading on NSE IFSC today
257.article_body: The NSE International Financial Services Centre (IFSC) platform in Gujarat's GIFT City will start trading in eight US stocks from today. The stocks include Tesla, Amazon, Alphabet (Google), Apple, Meta Platforms (Facebook), Microsoft, Netflix and Walmart. To make US stocks accessible to Indians, market makers will buy shares in US and issue unsponsored depositary receipts against them, NSE said.

258.title: Haryana starts help desk at Mumbai airport for students back from Ukraine
258.article_body: The Haryana government has set up help desk at Mumbai airport to help students returning from Ukraine. "We are in constant touch with government to ensure that all Haryana students are back safely and will assist them in every possible way," an official statement said. The Haryana government help desk at Delhi airport is also helping students returning from Ukraine.

259.title: Reliance to invest ₹1,670 cr in Sanmina to make electronics in India
259.article_body: Reliance Industries will be investing ₹1,670 crore in a joint venture with US-listed Sanmina for making electronic products in India. Reliance will hold a 50.1% stake in the JV after the investment in Sanmina's existing Indian entity. The new entity will serve both domestic and export markets. It aims to make hardware for 5G communications, among other things.

260.title: Tamil Nadu girl held for raising anti-BJP slogans gets ₹2 lakh compensation
260.article_body: Tamil Nadu's State Human Rights Commission (SHRC) has ordered payment of ₹2 lakh as compensation to a Canada-based girl student from the state. The girl was arrested for raising anti-BJP government slogans on a flight in which the then BJP state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan was a co-passenger in 2018. "Money be recovered from police personnel who arrested her," SHRC ordered.

261.title: Putin will go for blood beyond Ukraine, he wants a new Russian empire: Ukraine
261.article_body: Andriy Yermak, the head of the Presidential Office of Ukraine, has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin will "go for blood beyond Ukraine", adding, "He must be stopped." He further said that Putin wants to create a new Russian empire. Russia's war with Ukraine "could be a prologue to a greater European or even global massacre", he stated.

262.title: This may be the last time you see me alive, Zelenskyy told EU leaders on video: Report
262.article_body: An EU official has told Reuters that Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's concluding message to EU leaders' online emergency summit after Russia began invasion was, "This may be the last time you see me alive." Dressed in army fatigues, Zelenskyy was reportedly speaking from a bunker. Another official said, "There was a stunned silence and some had tears in their eyes."

263.title: India focussed on 2 things, we urge India to take clear position: US on Russian invasion
263.article_body: The US administration is trying to urge India to take a "clear position" on the Russia-Ukraine crisis, US diplomat Donald Lu said. "India has focused on two things when trying to explain its position. The possibility of a diplomatic resolution of this conflict. The second thing that they emphasise is India has 18,000 students still in Ukraine," he added.

264.title: 4,800 Indian students to be evacuated from Romania by Friday: Scindia
264.article_body: Around 4,800 Indian students will be evacuated from Bucharest and Suceava in Romania through 24 flights between Wednesday and Friday amid the Russia-Ukraine war, Jyotiraditya Scindia, Union Minister for Civil Aviation, said. India has been evacuating its citizens through special flights from Ukraine's western neighbours. On Wednesday, Scindia interacted with the Indian students in Bucharest.

265.title: Hospitals in Ukraine running out of oxygen amid war: WHO
265.article_body: The WHO warned that hospitals in Ukraine are running out of oxygen supplies amid the ongoing war.  "Critical shortages of oxygen will...impact...the ability to treat patients with COVD-19 and...other conditions," WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said. "At least three major oxygen plants in Ukraine have now closed and we're seeking ways of accessing oxygen from neighbouring nations," he added.

266.title: Noida Police retains top spot across UP in 112 response for 8th month in row
266.article_body: The Gautam Buddh Nagar Police has bagged the top spot in Uttar Pradesh for the month of February in terms of response time to emergency calls on the 112 service, official data showed. The response time was at 6.32 minutes in February, as per the data. The district has retained top spot among 75 districts in UP since July 2021.

267.title: 4 arrested with unaccounted gold worth ₹16 crore on Konark Express
267.article_body: Four people were detained by Government Railway Police (GRP) on Mumbai-Bhubaneswar Konark Express on Wednesday. The GRP became suspicious of the movement of the four accused and checked their luggage. They seized 32 kg of unaccounted gold worth ₹16 crore from their possession. The accused couldn't produce valid GST documents of the seized gold jewellery during investigation, GRP official said.

268.title: 6,000 people fined ₹3.31 crore for not wearing helmets in Pune
268.article_body: A total of 6,000 people were fined in Pune for riding their two-wheelers without a helmet in the first two months of this year, officials said. A fine of ₹3.31 crore has been collected from the violators. According to reports, the Pune Police department had collected ₹90 crore in fines from 18 lakh helmet-less riders in 2021.

269.title: Govt launches 'Stree Manoraksha Project' to improve women's mental health
269.article_body: Ministry of Women and Child Development (MoWCD) launched the 'Stree Manoraksha Project' in collaboration with NIMHANS Bengaluru on Wednesday. The project aims at improving mental health of women by enhancing the One-Stop Centres (OSC) across India. "New initiatives...will equip OSC functionaries with better understanding & resources to assist distressed women," WCD Minister Smriti Irani tweeted.

270.title: Never showed hand to any astrologer: Prabhas on playing palmist in Radhe Shyam
270.article_body: When asked if he believes in astrology, Prabhas, who'll portray the role of a palmist in 'Radhe Shyam', said he believes in "faith". "I never showed hand to any palmist," he added. "When I heard the story, I was surprised to get an offer to play a palmist in the film...It is a fight between love and destiny," Prabhas said.

271.title: Ukraine Prez urges Jews to speak up after Russia bombs Holocaust site
271.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy exhorted Jews to speak up after the Russians reportedly bombed Holocaust massacre site Babyn Yar in Kyiv killing five people. "Don't you see what is happening? Millions of Jews around the world, do not stay silent. Because Nazism is born in silence. Scream about murdering of civilians, scream about murdering of Ukrainians." he said.

272.title: Policeman shoots 12-year-old dead in US’ Philadelphia
272.article_body: The US' Philadelphia police shot dead a 12-year-old boy after a bullet hit their unmarked car. The police said they were in the area responding to some social media posts about a gun. One of the officers reportedly chased down the boy, who they claimed was fleeing carrying a gun, and shot him in the back.

273.title: Ukraine-returnee's family welcomes her in Delhi with flowers, feeds her
273.article_body: Family of Indian student who returned from Ukraine amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis, welcomed her at Delhi airport. The family welcomed the girl, Ujjala Gupta, with garland and showered flowers on her. She was also fed at the airport. "I request the government to bring back the students stuck in Kyiv and Kharkiv as the situation there is serious," Ujjala said.

274.title: Premier League captains to wear armbands in Ukrainian colours to show support
274.article_body: Premier League captains will wear armbands in Ukrainian colours this weekend to show support for the country amid Russia's invasion. "The 20 club captains will wear special armbands...Big screens at stadiums will display 'Football Stands Together' against the backdrop of the blue and yellow colours of the Ukrainian flag," Premier League said in a statement.

275.title: Average temperatures rising across seasons since 1991: IMD
275.article_body: Average temperatures across seasons have seen a sharp upward trend in the country since 1991, according to IMD. The trend is in comparison to the average surface air temperature baseline recorded between 1981 and 2010. Heat waves associated with abnormally high temperatures over certain areas are also on a rise across the country.

276.title: 8-yr-old practising acrobatics in room accidentally hangs self with ribbons in Argentina
276.article_body: An eight-year-old girl died in Argentina allegedly after accidentally hanging herself while practising acrobatics with fabric ribbons in her bedroom. Her parents reportedly found her hanging from the fabric and tried to revive her. "It is not goodbye, it is see you soon Laylita. We are going to miss you a lot, Princess," her family wrote on social media.

277.title: Google to open some US, UK, Asia Pacific offices for 3 days/week in April
277.article_body: Google will require most employees in some of its US, UK and Asia Pacific offices to work from office three days a week from April 4, Reuters reported. Everyone coming to office will have to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have approved exemption. All fully-vaccinated employees won't have to wear masks in San Francisco Bay Area offices.

278.title: Don't want to criticise but govt lagging behind in Ukraine evacuation: Mamata
278.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the Central government over the evacuation of citizens from war-hit Ukraine and said that it is "lagging behind on matters of external affairs". "I don't want to criticise the government on matters of external affairs. But...we are lagging behind on this matter because of some coordination gap and political businesses," Banerjee said.

279.title: Amazon may file criminal case over Future's transfer of stores to Reliance: Report
279.article_body: Amazon is reportedly planning to initiate criminal court proceedings against Future Retail for allowing the transfer of assets to Reliance Industries. Earlier, Reuters reported that Mukesh Ambani-led RIL had started taking over 500 of Future's stores. The development came amid Future's ongoing legal battle with Amazon over its ₹24,713-crore sale of retail assets to RIL.

280.title: UAE suspends visa-free travel for Ukrainians as thousands flee war
280.article_body: The United Arab Emirates has temporarily suspended a visa waiver for Ukrainian citizens, Kyiv's embassy in UAE said, as thousands of Ukrainians flee Russia's invading army. "It's actually a crime...if they don't let Ukrainians enter the country right now and require a visa. How should they get a visa at this moment, it's impossible," a Ukrainian woman in Dubai said.

281.title: Christian pastor claims mob assaulted him over forced conversions in Delhi
281.article_body: A 35-year-old Christian pastor has claimed that he was allegedly tied up and assaulted by a mob accusing him of conducting forced religious conversions in Delhi's Fatehpur Beri on February 25. The mob allegedly tied the man to a road divider and forced him to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' when he was going to the church.

282.title: Which countries supported Russia at UN General Assembly session on Ukraine conflict?
282.article_body: Other than Russia, four countries voted against UN General Assembly resolution that demanded Russia "immediately, completely and unconditionally" withdraw its military forces from Ukraine. Belarus, North Korea, Eritrea and Syria voted against the resolution. A total of 141 countries voted in favour of the resolution, while 35 countries including India abstained from voting.

283.title: Video shows Russian soldier breaking down as Ukrainians give him tea, help him call mom
283.article_body: A video has been widely shared on social media purportedly showing a Russian soldier breaking down as Ukrainians gave him tea and food after he surrendered. In the video, Ukrainians can be seen helping him video call his mother. The soldier is seen breaking down as his mother tells him, "Everything will be okay, my son."

284.title: Not just India, Kohli left legacy for world cricket as Test captain: Karthik
284.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has said the intensity with which India has played Test cricket under Virat Kohli in the last couple of years has been phenomenal. Karthik added, "I don't think Virat has left a legacy just for Indian cricket, he has left it for world cricket." He further said, "Virat brought fitness to the table...and made that a mandate."

285.title: It's my same handsome self: SRK to fan who asked him to reveal his Pathaan look
285.article_body: During an AMA session on Twitter, a fan asked Shah Rukh Khan when was he going to reveal his look from 'Pathaan', the actor replied, "I look the same...since 32 years now...What look...it’s [my] same...handsome self." Speaking about returning to the sets of a film, Shah Rukh wrote, "Set is where I belong. So it was like going back home."

286.title: 12-time champion Rafael Nadal set to play Barcelona Open in April
286.article_body: Barcelona Open tournament organisers on Wednesday said 12-time winner Rafael Nadal is set to play the Barcelona Open in April. Nadal will try to defend his title which he won in 2021, beating Stefanos Tsitsipas in the final. The Barcelona Open and Roland Garros are the two tournaments where Nadal has won at least 12 times in his career.

287.title: Russia keeps Indian Flag intact, covers US, UK, Japan flags on space rocket
287.article_body: A video showing Russia covering flags of US, Japan and UK, and leaving Indian Flag intact on a space rocket has gone viral. US, UK and Japan have imposed sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. "The launchers...decided that without the flags of some countries, our rocket would look more beautiful," Russian space agency ROSCOSMOS' chief Dmitry Rogozin said.

288.title: Walls in my chawl were so old that colours used to vanish: Bhansali
288.article_body: Talking about his experience while living in a chawl, filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said the walls in his chawl were so old that the colours used to vanish the moment the walls were coloured. "During my childhood, I used to pursue art in my homework and while painting the colourless walls," added Bhansali.

289.title: 167 held after communal clash in K'taka's Kalaburagi, Sec 144 extended till March 5
289.article_body: At least 167 people were arrested following a communal clash in Aland in Karnataka's Kalaburagi. A right-wing Hindu group had announced an event on Maha Shivaratri to purify a 'shivalinga' allegedly located on a dargah's premises and Muslim groups had planned a procession there the same day. Police imposed Section 144 anticipating unrest and have extended it till March 5.

290.title: I'm a strong guy but I might faint on meeting Big B: Actor Surya Sharma
290.article_body: Actor Surya Sharma said that even though he is a "very strong guy", he "might surely faint" the day he meets actor Amitabh Bachchan. "I loved Bachchan saab's angry young man characters from Zanjeer, Agneepath and Sharaabi. All these characters from these films touched my heart. He has been my inspiration," he added.

291.title: We broke Russia’s years of planning in a week: Ukraine Prez
291.article_body: Addressing the citizens in a Telegram video, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "We are a nation that broke the enemy's [Russia's] plans in a week. Plans written for years: sneaky, full of hatred for our country, our people." "I sincerely admire the Ukrainians who go out with their bare hands and chase the occupiers out of their cities," he added.

292.title: Man arrested in Ahmedabad for murder of Kolkata businessman
292.article_body: A person was arrested in Ahmedabad in connection with the murder of a city-based businessman, the Kolkata Police said. Police received a complaint that an unknown person had called the complainant to say that the businessman was kidnapped. However, when the businessman didn't return after his family paid the ransom, a search was conducted and later his body was recovered.

293.title: 3 Africans arrested in Chandigarh for ₹8 lakh customs duty fraud
293.article_body: Three African nationals were arrested by police for duping a man of ₹8.72 lakh in customs duty fraud in Chandigarh. They allegedly befriended him through a fake Facebook profile and said he'd receive a gift from UK. One of the accused, posing as a customs duty official later tricked him into paying customs fees for the parcel in multiple instalments.

294.title: Regret projecting a controversial image to gain fame: Poonam Pandey
294.article_body: Admitting that she regrets projecting a controversial image in public "big time", actress-model Poonam Pandey said she believed she could gain fame that way after being told so by people. "Now that I am presenting my real self, everyone is shocked why I portrayed something else. I have...made mistakes, got beaten up and...want to change the world's opinion," added Poonam.

295.title: Leadership never goes, but I feel Kohli will be more productive now: Gavaskar
295.article_body: With Virat Kohli set to play his first Test after stepping down as captain in Mohali against Sri Lanka, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the 33-year-old is going to be more productive than he has been in the past couple of years. "The leader in you never goes...But he's also going to be concentrating more on his batting," Gavaskar stated.

296.title: BMC to modernise dispensaries, provide telemedicine facilities
296.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will upgrade 10 dispensaries in the city by April. The dispensaries will be equipped with in-house diagnostic centres, telemedicine facilities and visits by super specialists from major hospitals. The transformation of the dispensaries is part of the BMC's strategy to establish 100 polyclinics and diagnostic centres across the city.

297.title: Admissions closing for Jigsaw, IIM-I’s online Product Management Program
297.article_body: Admissions are closing soon for Jigsaw & IIM Indore's 6th batch of online Product Management program. The 6-month program seeks to enable participants to go through the complete product life cycle & master Product Management phases. It offers a 5i Framework-based curriculum with Harvard Business Case-studies & BYOP feature, Jigsaw said, adding it's an ideal choice for next-gen product leaders.

298.title: Over 45,000 homeless, beggars vaccinated in Delhi: Govt tells SC
298.article_body: The Delhi government informed Supreme Court that as of February 27 over 45,000 people without identity cards, including homeless people and beggars, were vaccinated in the city. It was replying to a petition seeking COVID-19 vaccination for such people across the country. Further, over 3 crore doses have been administered in Delhi to people aged 15 and above, government added.

299.title: India reports 6,561 new COVID-19 cases, nearly 1,000 cases less than yesterday
299.article_body: India has reported 6,561 new COVID-19 cases and 142 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 7,554 cases and 223 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 77,152, while the death toll in the country reached 5,14,388. Over 4.2 crore people have recovered so far.

300.title: I had a lot of tears for many days: Melinda on divorce with Bill Gates
300.article_body: Melinda French Gates, during a CBS interview, opened up about her divorce with Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates after 27 years of marriage. "I had a lot of tears for many days...days where I'm literally laying on the floor...thinking, 'How can this be? How can I get up?" she said. According to Melinda, there were also days when she was "angry".

301.title: World's largest yacht worth ₹4,500 cr seized by Germany from Russian billionaire: Reports
301.article_body: German authorities have reportedly seized the $600-million superyacht belonging to Russian billionaire Alisher Usmanov in a Hamburg shipyard. The 512-foot yacht named Dilbar is the world’s largest motor yacht by gross tonnage at 15,917 tons. Usmanov was on a list of billionaires to face sanctions from European Union in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

302.title: Ukraine shares map showing countries that closed their airspace to Russian planes
302.article_body: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine took to Twitter to share a map showing countries that have closed their airspace to Russian planes. Apart from the European Union countries, Albania, Canada, Iceland, Moldova, North Macedonia, Montenegro, Norway, United Kingdom, USA and Switzerland have closed their airspace to Russia amid its invasion of Ukraine.

303.title: Youth rejecting caste-based leaders who are filling their family coffers: PM
303.article_body: Now people vote for their development and the development of the state and the country, PM Narendra Modi said. "I am also very satisfied that the youth are aware and understanding and they are continuously rejecting caste-based leaders who are just filling their family coffers," PM Modi added.

304.title: 51-yr-old man gets 4-year jail for molesting teenager in Mohali
304.article_body: A 51-year-old man was convicted to four years in jail for molesting a 15-year-old girl at Kambali village in Mohali. The incident took place in 2015 when the girl was studying in class 9. In her complaint, she had said Balraj Kumar, a general store owner, touched her inappropriately while she was on her way to school in November 2015.

305.title: 24-year-old man arrested for robbing bank employee in Pune
305.article_body: Pune City Police have arrested a 24-year-old man for allegedly robbing a bank employee of ₹67,000. Rohit Pawar was on a motorcycle when the accused and his accomplice intercepted him near Swargate bus depot. The duo then reportedly took Pawar to Mukund Nagar, thrashed him, took his PhonePe password, and transferred ₹67,000 to the bank account of the accused.

306.title: Russia's rating cut to 'junk' by Fitch & Moody's amid sanctions
306.article_body: Global rating agencies Fitch and Moody's have each cut Russia's sovereign credit rating by six notches to "junk" status after the country's invasion of Ukraine. Western sanctions imposed on Russia could undermine its capability and willingness to service debt, they said. Meanwhile, index providers FTSE Russell and MSCI announced that they will remove Russian equities from all their indexes.

307.title: I questioned myself after toxic relationships, friends showed me mirror: Neha
307.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia said that she has been in "toxic relationships". "I questioned myself...I have had so many [friends] who were not from the business and I still have them...and it's just like...here's the mirror, this is the reality and this is what you have a mirror for, not for vanity. So yeah, I have been okay," Neha said.

308.title: Don’t shoot people, let us collect bodies: Kherson mayor to Russian forces
308.article_body: The mayor of Ukraine's Kherson confirmed that the port city has been overrun by Russian troops. When the Russians reached the city administration building, Mayor Igor Kolykhaev urged them not to shoot civilians. "I simply asked them not to shoot at people," he said. He also asked them to allow them to collect the bodies from the streets.

309.title: Not the type of wicket I would have produced: Lyon on Rawalpindi pitch
309.article_body: Talking about the wicket for the first Test against Pakistan in Rawalpindi, Australia spinner Nathan Lyon said, "It's similar to UAE wicket...there isn't much grass." He added, "Expecting it to be pretty nice to bat on the first couple of days." Lyon, however, also stated that it's not the type of wicket he would have produced as a curator.

310.title: Trans students enrolled for HSC, SSC exams highest in Mumbai division
310.article_body: The Maharashtra state board has received total 229 applications of transgender students to appear for the HSC, SSC exams, out of which 42 applications are from Mumbai division, the highest number in Maharashtra. As per the data, 40 will appear from Nashik, 37 from Pune and 35 from Aurangabad division. The section for transgender students was first introduced in 2019.

311.title: Hyd's Cyberabad Police busts plan to assassinate T'gana minister, 8 held
311.article_body: Cyberabad Police busted a conspiracy to assassinate Telangana Tourism and Excise Minister V Srinivas Goud and arrested eight persons in connection with the case. Three of the accused were arrested in Delhi and brought to Hyderabad, Cyberabad Commissioner of Police Stephen Raveendra said. Their location was traced and found to be BJP leader AP Jithender Reddy's servant quarters, police added.

312.title: No such report received: Govt as Russia says Indians held hostage by Ukrainians
312.article_body: The Indian government has released a statement after Russian Defence Ministry alleged that Ukrainian forces are keeping a large group of Indian students as "hostages". "We note that with the cooperation of the Ukrainian authorities, many students have left Kharkiv yesterday. We have not received any reports of any hostage situation regarding any student," the government said.

313.title: Time to decide between BJP & terror-supporting people: UP CM Yogi
313.article_body: On the day of polling for the sixth phase of UP Assembly polls, CM Yogi Adityanath on Thursday said that the elections have reached the decisive stage and each vote to BJP is a step towards making UP India's number one economy. "It is time to decide between us and terror-supporting people," CM Yogi said.

314.title: Apple to host its 1st event of 2022 'Peek Performance' on March 8
314.article_body: Apple will be hosting its first event of 2022, called 'Peek Performance', on March 8. The event will be a digital-only gathering with no members of the media invited to attend in person. Apple is reportedly expected to launch the next-generation version of the iPhone SE, a revamped iPad Air, and a high-end Mac Mini.

315.title: No one can take away Muslims’ voting rights in India: Tejashwi Yadav
315.article_body: Days after Bihar BJP MLA Haribhushan Thakur said Muslims in India should live like second-class citizens, Leader of Opposition Tejashwi Yadav responded by saying, "No 'Mai ka laal' (son of a mother) can take away the voting rights of Muslims." "Shahnawaz bhai, your citizenship is at stake," he added, pointing towards BJP minister Syed Shahnawaz Hussain.

316.title: MU library shifting to new building, to be operational by March 15: Min
316.article_body: The Jawaharlal Nehru Library of Mumbai University will be shifting to the new library building by March 15, said state Higher and Technical Education Minister Uday Samant. Earlier, the minister visited the library located in Mumbai University's Kalina campus which has come under the scanner for its poor condition, putting books and lives of students in danger.

317.title: Indian students kept as hostages by Ukrainian authorities in Kharkiv: Russia
317.article_body: Russia has accused Ukrainian authorities of keeping Indian students in Kharkiv as hostages and said its armed forces were ready to take all necessary measures to safely evacuate them. The accusation was denied by Ukraine which asked countries "whose students have become hostages of the Russian armed aggression" to demand opening a humanitarian corridor to other Ukrainian cities.

318.title: How can a person’s rate be ₹20: Bhansali on watching sex-workers as a kid
318.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said that he would see sex workers on his way to school everyday. "How can a person's rate be ₹20...We can't be sold for ₹5 or ₹20 or ₹50. It is inhuman," he said, adding, "They make themselves up. They put so much paint and powder, look at the grief...How do you camouflage that grief?"

319.title: I wanted to but he has changed now: Bhansali on working with Salman Khan
319.article_body: Sanjay Leela Bhansali said he has left it up to actor Salman Khan to decide if they'd be able to work together again. "Salman is a...dear friend, and I wanted to work with him after 'Padmaavat'...For whatever reasons, it didn't turn out," he said. "We all change as people. So he has changed; in his mind, I've changed," Bhansali added.

320.title: Netflix pauses all projects, acquisitions in Russia: Report
320.article_body: Netflix has temporarily stopped all future projects and acquisitions in Russia amid the ongoing invasion by Russia in Ukraine, Reuters reported citing sources. It had four Russian-language series in production and post-production, including a detective drama "Zato". Earlier, Netflix had refused to add state-run channels to its Russian service, despite a regulation in place over the same.

321.title: 7.1-kg ganja worth over ₹4 lakh seized at railway station in Bengaluru
321.article_body: Bengaluru's Railway Protection Force (RPF) said that they have seized 7.1 kg of ganja worth ₹4,26,000 at Banaswadi Railway Station. The operation was led by Umesh Dhakar, Inspector, RPF, Baiyyappanahalli, it added. Separately, RPF personnel also arrested two people for "indulging in illegal procuring and supplying railway tickets". A total of 64 tickets worth ₹93,895 were seized from them.

322.title: Stayed with cat in bunker: Indians share tales of pets they brought from Ukraine
322.article_body: After Centre relaxed evacuation norms for pets, Indian students brought their pets from war-torn Ukraine. "This cat has been with me for past four months. It stayed with me in bunker and then we crossed into Poland together," said Gautam, who reached Delhi in IAF's C-17 aircraft. "I have brought my friend's dog with me," said Zahid, another returnee.

323.title: 42-yr-old woman found dead at home in Gurugram, husband booked
323.article_body: A 42-year-old woman was found dead at her rented home in Gurugram's Sushant Lok on Wednesday, police said. Her second husband, who is on the run, has been booked for the alleged murder. "The couple often fought with each other. The suspect was an alcoholic and also a drug addict. He recently left work and stayed at home," police added.

324.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad will have to recycle sewage water in 10-15 yrs: Ex-official
324.article_body: Pravin Ladkat, former joint city engineer of Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation said civic body is planning to increase sewage treatment plants and their capacities. He said area's population is 27 lakh currently and will go up to 40 lakh in 10-15 years. "We will have to...recycle and reuse water...We plan to treat sewage water...then release it into the river," Ladkat said.

325.title: Shahid Kapoor's sister Sanah Kapur marries Mayank Pahwa, pics surface
325.article_body: Actress Sanah Kapur, daughter of Pankaj Kapur and Supriya Pathak, tied the knot with actor and assistant director Mayank Pahwa on Wednesday. Actor Shahid Kapoor took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with his sister and wrote, "How time flies and little bitto is now a bride. All grown up all too soon my baby sister."

326.title: EU cuts 7 Russian banks from global payment system SWIFT, bans RT & Sputnik
326.article_body: The European Union has said that it is cutting seven Russian banks, including the country's second-biggest lender VTB Bank, from the main international payment system SWIFT. The list doesn't include Russia's largest lender Sberbank and Gazprombank, which handle payments for Russian oil. The EU also banned Russian state-run media outlets RT and Sputnik over disinformation on Ukraine's invasion.

327.title: Don't blame students: Priyanka on minister's 'students were unwilling to leave Ukraine' claim
327.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi has criticised the blame-game over the evacuation of Indian students in Ukraine after Union Minister V Muraleedharan said students didn't want to leave as universities refused to conduct online classes. "Sir. Please stop. Please for heavens sake don't blame the students when they are mentally traumatised and struggling to get out of Kharkiv," Chaturvedi said.

328.title: Russian billionaire Abramovich to sell Chelsea, donate net proceeds to Ukraine victims
328.article_body: Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich, who bought Chelsea in 2003, has decided to sell the football club. All "net proceeds from the sale" will be donated to all "victims of the war in Ukraine", he said in a press release. Abramovich said he'll not ask the club to repay him the reported £1.5 billion he has loaned them in 19 years.

329.title: Conor McGregor considering buying Chelsea, shares screenshot of WhatsApp chat
329.article_body: Ex-UFC featherweight and lightweight champion Conor McGregor took to Twitter to suggest that he is considering buying Chelsea, which has been put on sale by their Russian owner Roman Abramovich. McGregor posted a screenshot of a WhatsApp chat in which he had sent some messages reading: "Chelsea for sale £3bn. Let's buy it." "I wish to explore this," McGregor tweeted.

330.title: India explains why it abstained from UNGA vote deploring Russia's aggression
330.article_body: Explaining why it abstained from UN General Assembly vote deploring Russia's aggression against Ukraine, India said, "India supports the international community's call for an immediate ceasefire. We also support safe humanitarian access to conflict zones." It added, "India urges that all Member States demonstrate their commitment to the principles of the UN Charter."

331.title: Russian entrepreneur's 'Wanted: dead or alive' post on Putin goes viral; offers $1 mn
331.article_body: A $1 million bounty has been placed on Russian President Vladimir Putin by entrepreneur Alex Konanykhin after the invasion of Ukraine. Alex Konanykhin's 'Wanted: dead or alive' post on Putin, in which he wrote, "Putin is not the Russian President as he...violated the Constitution by eliminating free elections and murdering his opponents," went viral on social media.

332.title: 3-year-old boy dies after coming in contact with live wire in Pune
332.article_body: A three-year-old boy, Shahzad Amir Sayyed, died of electrocution after touching live wire in Pune's Kondhwa area. The wire was protruding from a distribution panel (DP) box near his house. "My son was on his way home...He was playing with stick which fell...he bent down to pick it...got electrocuted. He was stuck to wire...fell down...after he died," boy's father said.

333.title: Voting underway for 6th phase of Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections
333.article_body: The sixth phase of polling for the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections began at 7 am on Thursday. As many as 676 candidates, including Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, are contesting on 57 seats spread across 10 districts in the sixth phase. The voting for 292 of the 403 Assembly seats has been completed till now in five phases.

334.title: 15-year-old boy drowns in stream in Thane; doctors declare him dead
334.article_body: A 15-year-old boy drowned in a stream in Thane's Diva on Wednesday, police said. He was taken to a hospital, however, doctors declared him dead before admission. An official said that the deceased boy went to the stream with his two friends. "The two other boys knew swimming but [he] was unable to swim...and, hence, he drowned," the official added.

335.title: Disclosure of veg, non-veg ingredients of food items fundamental: Delhi HC
335.article_body: Delhi High Court has said it's "fundamental" to provide a "complete disclosure" about a food item being "vegetarian or non-vegetarian". It said that fundamental rights of people are impacted by what is offered on the platter. The court had earlier ordered food company owners to give a "complete disclosure" of all components used in the production of any food products.

336.title: Man sexually assaults 15-yr-old after offering ride in tempo near Mumbai
336.article_body: A man has been arrested by police for allegedly sexually assaulting a minor girl after offering her a ride in a tempo in Bhayandar near Mumbai. The accused allegedly took the 15-year-old to a shed in Nallasopara forcefully. The accused had also threatened to kill her if she informed anyone about the crime.

337.title: Explosion lights up night sky in various colours as scooter thrown on rail track in UK
337.article_body: A loud explosion was heard and fire lit up the night sky in orange, blue and white colours after a group of youths threw a scooter onto rail tracks causing an electrical fault in UK's Southampton. British Transport Police and firefighters were called to St Denys station and the scooter was recovered. Several people shared the explosion's video on Twitter.

338.title: India abstains as UN General Assembly adopts resolution deploring Russia's aggression
338.article_body: India has abstained on the UN General Assembly resolution that strongly deplored Russia's aggression against Ukraine. The UN General Assembly has adopted the resolution after a total of 141 members voted in the favour of the resolution while 5 members opposed it. India was among 35 nations who abstained from voting.

339.title: We offer sympathies to India: Ukraine's UN envoy after Indian student died in shelling
339.article_body: Ukraine Ambassador to UN Sergiy Kyslytsya condoled the demise of 21-year-old Indian student Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar. He said, "Ukraine deeply regrets that a student from India has become a victim of this shelling by the Russian Armed Forces." "We offer our deepest sympathies to India and the relatives of the victim," Kyslytsya stated.

340.title: Bollywood actors including SRK inspiration for Radhe Shyam: Prabhas
340.article_body: Actor Prabhas during the launch event of his upcoming movie 'Radhe Shyam' said Amitabh Bachchan, Salman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan are his inspirations from Bollywood for his new movie. "Amitabh sir is a legend, everybody loves him," he added. The actor also emphasised on the importance of Indian films and talked about the success of Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa'.

341.title: Over 2,000 Ukrainian civilians killed since invasion began: Ukraine
341.article_body: Ukraine's emergency service on Wednesday said over 2,000 Ukrainian civilians have been killed so far since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began last week. "Children, women and defence forces are losing their lives every hour," the emergency service said in a statement. It added that Russia has destroyed hundreds of structures including homes, kindergartens, hospitals and transport facilities.

342.title: Suriya offers prayers for Indians in Ukraine at his film's trailer launch
342.article_body: Actor Suriya offered a joint prayer along with his fans for the safe return of the Indians stuck in Ukraine at his upcoming film's trailer launch on Wednesday. Speaking after the launch of the trailer of 'Etharkkum Thunindhavan', he said, "Let us all pray together that without any loss of life, everybody must safely come back home."

343.title: It was a dream come true: Actor Manav Kaul on working with Madhuri
343.article_body: Actor Manav Kaul, while sharing about his experience working with veteran actress Madhuri Dixit in Netflix series 'The Fame Game' said it was a dream come true. The 'Kai Po Che' and 'Tumhari Sulu' actor further said he was initially nervous, adding, "When we started shooting...felt like I was working with an actor who was equally invested in the project."

344.title: Fitbit recalls over 10 lakh Ionic smartwatches in US over burn injury risk
344.article_body: Google-owned Fitbit has recalled over 10 lakh of its Ionic smartwatches over reports that overheating batteries caused burn injuries, the US Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) said on Wednesday. Fitbit received at least 115 reports of the incident in the US and 59 from overseas. Some incidents even caused second- and third-degree burns. "These incidents are very rare," Fitbit said.

345.title: Russian F1 driver banned from British Grand Prix
345.article_body: Formula One's Russian driver Nikita Mazepin has been barred from participating in the British Grand Prix following a Motorsport UK decision amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The Haas driver was permitted to continue racing in Formula One 2022 after the FIA opted against banning Russian and Belarusian drivers by allowing them to compete under a neutral flag.

346.title: Photographer saves Alia Bhatt from getting hit by branch, video surfaces
346.article_body: A photographer saved Alia Bhatt from getting hit by a branch of a tree while she was promoting her film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' on an open bus on the movie's release date. The video of the incident shows Alia covering her face with her saree and ducking as the photographer accompanying her is seen lifting the branch up to save her.

347.title: F1 champion Max Verstappen to sign new deal with Red Bull: Reports
347.article_body: Formula One world champion Max Verstappen has reportedly agreed a new long-term deal with Red Bull. The deal is said to be worth around €40-50 million per year, making it one of the most lucrative contract deals in F1. Verstappen's current contract with Red Bull expires in 2023. "I'm very, very happy where I am, that's for sure," Verstappen said.

348.title: Terrorists shoot dead panchayat member at his home in J&K's Kulgam
