348.article_body: A panchayat member in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district was shot dead by terrorists on Wednesday, officials said. Mohammad Yaqub Dar was critically injured after he was attacked at his residence. He was taken to a hospital where he succumbed to the injuries, the officials added.

349.title: Mamata shown black flags during visit to Varanasi, video surfaces
349.article_body: Members of the Hindu Yuva Vahini protested against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday during her visit to PM Narendra Modi's Lok Sabha constituency Varanasi. A video shared by BJP's Amit Malviya shows protesters raising slogans and waving black flags at her while police tried to control the crowd. "Mamata Banerjee wapas jao (go back)," said a few protesters.

350.title: Will start metro in 5 districts if BJP retains power in UP: Nadda
350.article_body: BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda on Wednesday promised the BJP-led government will start metro services in Uttar Pradesh's Agra, Gorakhpur, Varanasi, Prayagraj and Meerut in the next five years if BJP retains power. "UP has marked the lowest unemployment rate under the Yogi government. Through MSMEs, over three lakh jobs have been created in the state," Nadda further said.

351.title: No student from the state is stranded in Kyiv anymore: Himachal CM
351.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur on Wednesday said that no student from the state was stranded in Ukraine's capital, Kyiv. "Government is putting efforts for the protection of students in Ukraine and bringing them back as soon as possible," he said. However, some are still stuck in Kharkiv, where an Indian student was killed on Tuesday, he added.

352.title: Japan ready to take in Ukrainians fleeing Russian invasion: PM
352.article_body: Japan is willing to take in Ukrainian refugees who are fleeing Russian invasion, Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said on Wednesday. Kishida has asked Poland's PM Mateusz Morawiecki to help Japanese citizens who are stranded in Ukraine enter Poland swiftly via land routes. Over 8.7 lakh Ukrainians have fled the country since the invasion last week, the UN said.

353.title: Afghan man walks barefoot in snow to protest unfair distribution of aid
353.article_body: A man from Afghanistan's Daikundi province walked several miles barefoot in snow to protest the alleged unfair distribution of humanitarian aid, local media reported. He reportedly said the amount of humanitarian aid in Daikundi province is small compared to other provinces. He alleged that local Taliban officials are distributing aid to their relatives and not reaching out to deserving people.

354.title: PM Modi speaks to Putin, discusses safe evacuation of Indians
354.article_body: PM Narendra Modi spoke on the phone today with Russian President Vladimir Putin, according to an official statement. The leaders reviewed the situation in Ukraine, especially in Kharkiv where many Indian students are stuck. They also discussed the safe evacuation of the Indian nationals from the conflict areas.

355.title: Explosion lights up night sky in various colours as scooter thrown on rail track in UK
355.article_body: A loud explosion was heard and fire lit up the night sky in orange, blue and white colours after a group of youths threw a scooter onto rail tracks causing an electrical fault in UK's Southampton. British Transport Police and firefighters were called to St Denys station and the scooter was recovered. Several people shared the explosion's video on Twitter.

356.title: Going to Varanasi to campaign for SP's Akhilesh Yadav: Mamata
356.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday said that she was going to Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi to campaign for Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav. Banerjee was at the Kolkata airport and said, "I will go to the temple. I am taking the blessings of people and going to UP," she said.

357.title: Everton suspend multiple sponsorship deals with Russian companies
357.article_body: Everton on Wednesday said the club has suspended sponsorship deals with USM Holdings, Megafon and Yota. All three are associated with Alisher Usmanov, a billionaire whose assets were frozen by the EU due to his "particularly close ties to Russian President Vladimir Putin". Everton will reportedly start removing their logos from its stadium Goodison Park and training ground Finch Farm.

358.title: Russia's war is based on lies: German Foreign Minister Baerbock
358.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Tuesday called on UN member states to strongly condemn Russia's invasion of Ukraine, adding, "Russia's war is one of aggression and it is based on lies." Baerbock spoke at an emergency meeting of the UN General Assembly. Baerbock accused Russia of abusing its power as a permanent member of the UN Security Council.

359.title: Eastern Ukraine cities remain areas of concern: Govt on stranded Indians
359.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs while talking about the evacuation process of Indians from Ukraine said the cities in eastern Ukraine remain areas of concern. "Some students were able to board trains out of Kharkiv [Tuesday] night and [Wednesday] morning," MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. The Indian embassy in Ukraine has asked Indians in Kharkiv to leave the city immediately.

360.title: Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj' to release on June 3
360.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor Akshay Kumar announced that his upcoming film 'Prithviraj' will release on June 3. "Elated to announce that Samrat Prithviraj Chauhan's grand saga is arriving sooner on the big screen," Akshay wrote. The film was slated to release on June 10. 'Prithviraj' also features former Miss World Manushi Chhillar and actor Sanjay Dutt.

361.title: Why weren't the students stuck in Ukraine evacuated earlier: Mamata
361.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday asked why Indian students were not brought back from Ukraine earlier when the Central government became aware of the developments. "Somebody died. Some people are moving from here and there. Somebody is waiting in bunkers, somebody is waiting in Romania, somebody is not getting food," she further said.

362.title: Govt prepared a draft for women's empowerment policy: Maha Minister
362.article_body: Maharashtra Minister for Women and Child Development Yashomati Thakur has said that the state government has prepared a draft for the new women's empowerment policy that takes a holistic view of gender equality. "The policy focuses on the social and economic development of women and persons belonging to the LGBTQIA lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans, queer, intersex, asexual community," Thakur said.

363.title: Israel, Germany call for an increase in Russia-Ukraine peace talks
363.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett on Wednesday called for increased peace talks between Russia and Ukraine. "I'm very thankful that both of us are going to do what we can to make sure that talks between Ukraine and Russia will soon be continued," Scholz said on his first tour to Israel as German chancellor.

364.title: Requirement to wear masks indoors at Pentagon dropped by US military
364.article_body: The US military on Wednesday said it is dropping indoor mask requirements for 20,000 military and civilian employees at the Pentagon, after the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) updated its COVID-19 guidelines. The decision follows the White House telling federal agencies on Monday that they can remove mask mandates for visitors and employees in US federal buildings.

365.title: Russian, Belarusian athletes to compete as neutrals at Paralympics
365.article_body: The International Paralympic Committee (IPC) on Wednesday said Russian and Belarusian athletes can compete as neutrals in the upcoming Winter Paralympics in Beijing. "They will compete under the Paralympic flag and not be included in the medal table," the IPC said. The IPC added they will not host any events in Russia or Belarus until further notice.

366.title: Woman kills 34-yr-old husband over domestic dispute in Rajasthan
366.article_body: A woman allegedly strangled her 34-year-old husband to death in the Barmer district of Rajasthan, police said on Wednesday. According to the police, the couple was addicted to alcohol and had a dispute on Tuesday evening. The Station House Officer (SHO) of Kotwali Police Station, Ugamraj Soni, said that the accused was unhappy with her husband's low income.

367.title: Shibani Dandekar dismisses pregnancy rumours, says 'It was tequila'
367.article_body: Actress Shibani Dandekar put an end to the rumours that suggested she was pregnant. Taking to Instagram Stories, Shibani posted a photo of herself and wrote, "I am nottttt pregnant! It was the tequila." Rumours began after users speculated the reason behind Shibani's bloated stomach in the comment section of her wedding photo with her husband Farhan Akhtar.

368.title: 4 IAF's C-17s to bring back 800 Indians from Ukraine in next 12 hrs
368.article_body: India on Wednesday sent four C-17 military transport aircraft to Romania, Poland and Hungary to evacuate Indian students from Ukraine, officials said. The first IAF aircraft from Romania is likely to land at Hindon airbase at 1.30 am, officials added. Three more aircraft will return by 8 am on Thursday. The four aircraft will bring back about 800 Indian evacuees.

369.title: 8-yr-old practising acrobatics in room accidentally hangs self with ribbons in Argentina
369.article_body: An eight-year-old girl died in Argentina allegedly after accidentally hanging herself while practising acrobatics with fabric ribbons in her bedroom. Her parents reportedly found her hanging from the fabric and tried to revive her. "It is not goodbye, it is see you soon Laylita. We are going to miss you a lot, Princess," her family wrote on social media.

370.title: 25-yr-old woman from Punjab dies after being hit with rod in Canada
370.article_body: A 25-year-old woman from Punjab's Kapurthala died on Wednesday after she was allegedly hit on the head with a rod by a Canadian national last week. The woman, who had gone to Canada on a study visa six years ago, was currently working as a private security guard. A man known to the family confirmed her death.

371.title: Man rapes 45-year-old co-worker in Bhopal factory, arrested
371.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was allegedly raped by her co-worker in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh. The incident took place on February 24 when the victim, who works at a bottle cleaning plant in the city, was alone in the factory. Police have now arrested the accused, who also allegedly threatened the victim with dire consequences if she reported the matter to others.

372.title: SEBI didn't dilute orders on NSE matter, acted as per remit: Ex-SEBI Chief
372.article_body: Former SEBI Chairman Ajay Tyagi on Wednesday said the regulator didn't "dilute" its orders on the National Stock Exchange issue, and that it "came out with orders within [SEBI's] remit and understanding". This comes days after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government was analysing if SEBI took "necessary punitive" action in the matter. SEBI's working is transparent, Tyagi added.

373.title: Scindia takes injured girl to seat in evacuation flight; video shows her asking for selfie
373.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia taking an Indian girl who was stranded in Ukraine to front row of the evacuation flight and asking fellow passengers to take care of her. She had a ligament tear and reportedly was stuck in Bucharest. The video also shows the girl requesting Scindia for a selfie with her.

374.title: Was asked to step down from projects due to pregnancy: Neha Dhupia
374.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia revealed that she was asked to step down from projects due to her pregnancy. "You're like 'okay, maybe it's not the requirement of the role'...and you just got to wait and you part ways amicably," she added. Referring to Kareena Kapoor Khan shooting for 'Laal Singh Chaddha' during her pregnancy, Neha said, "I really respect her."

375.title: Putin's Russia has already committed war crimes in Ukraine: UK PM
375.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin's regime has already committed war crimes in Ukraine. He said, "What we've seen already from...Putin's regime, in the use of the munitions that they've already been dropping on innocent civilians, in my view already fully qualifies as a war crime." Johnson, however, added, "With...heroism of Ukraine's people...Putin will fail."

376.title: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's 'Ponniyin Selvan-1' to release on Sept 30
376.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's 'Ponniyin Selvan-1' will receive a theatrical release on September 30. The film is directed by Mani Ratnam. It will also feature Vikram, Jayam Ravi and Sobhita Dhulipala. The film is an adaptation of Kalki Krishnamurthy's novel 'Ponniyin Selvan'. The film is jointly produced by Lyca Productions and Madras Talkies.

377.title: India trying to increase its footprint in international gaming sector: PM Modi
377.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the gaming sector "is huge internationally" and India is trying to increase its footprint in it. "The number of youth connected to this market globally is increasing. That's why...we have focused on Animation Visual Effects Gaming Comic [in Budget 2022]," PM Modi said. "For us, technology is mainstay of making the country self-reliant," he added.

378.title: MLC elections in Bihar on April 4, counting of votes on April 7
378.article_body: The Election Commission of India (ECI) on Wednesday announced that biennial elections to 24 Legislative Council (MLC) seats in Bihar will be held on April 4. The candidates will be able to file their nominations till March 16 and the last date to withdraw one's candidature is March 21. Counting of votes will be held on April 7.

379.title: Aamir said show 'Pathaan' first: SRK on whether he watched 'Laal Singh...'
379.article_body: During the #AskSRK session, a Twitter user asked actor Shah Rukh Khan if he had watched actor Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. To this, Shah Rukh replied, "Arre yaar Aamir kehta hai pehle Pathaan dikha (Aamir said show 'Pathaan' first)!" 'Pathaan' also features John Abraham and Deepika Padukone. The film will release on January 25, 2023.

380.title: Hunger will kill people for sure if Russia doesn't: Ukrainian man
380.article_body: A resident of Ukraine's Kherson city, which is claimed to have been taken by Russian troops, said he's terrified and "has no hope". The man said, "I don't know if...Russians will kill us or not, but hunger will kill people here for sure." "I just hope...Russian President Vladimir Putin will think of civilians as humans for one time," he added.

381.title: Pic shows captured Russian soldier crying while saying 'I love you' to mother on phone
381.article_body: Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) has shared a picture of a captured Russian soldier who can be seen crying while talking on phone. SBU also shared the soldier's video, wherein he could be seen breaking down in tears while telling his mother "I love you too" over the phone. "They sent us to death, everyone killed everyone," he reportedly said.

382.title: Which major US & European companies have taken action against Russia?
382.article_body: British oil companies BP and Shell announced their exit from Russia following its invasion of Ukraine. Europe's Airbus and America's ExxonMobil and Boeing, have cut ties with Russia, while Harley-Davidson and General Motors suspended vehicle exports to Russia. Apple and Dell halted all product sales in Russia, and Apple said, "We are deeply concerned about the Russian invasion of Ukraine."

383.title: 21-yr-old Indian & girlfriend escape from Ukraine, say 'For 2 days we were on road'
383.article_body: Indians Harsh Panwar, 21, and his girlfriend Reva Shrivastava, 19, who met while studying medicine at a university in Ukraine, recently escaped the country. "It was...like crossing...border from cruelty to hospitality...For two days we were on the road without any shelter," said Shrivastava. From the Romanian border, they joined a group of students driven to villages near Bucharest's main airport.

384.title: Pujara, Rahane, Pandya get demoted in BCCI central contracts list
384.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara, Ajinkya Rahane and Hardik Pandya have been downgraded in latest central contracts list of BCCI that was ratified by the board's apex council on Wednesday. Pujara and Rahane, who were in Grade A (₹5 crore) are now in Grade B (₹3 crore). Pandya, who was in Grade A (₹5 crore), has been demoted to Grade C (₹1 crore).

385.title: No one will forgive Russia for killing peaceful people: Ukraine Prez
385.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has released a social media video, wherein he slammed Russia for killing "peaceful Ukrainian people". Zelensky said, "Russian forces brutally fired on Kharkiv from jet artillery. It was clearly a war crime. There will be an international tribunal." "No one in the world will forgive you [Russia] for killing peaceful Ukrainian people," he added.

386.title: Not true: NCB on reports claiming no evidence against Aryan in drugs case
386.article_body: Sanjay Singh, the Deputy Director General of the NCB, has refuted media reports that claimed there was no evidence against Aryan Khan in the Mumbai cruise drugs case. "These are not true...just speculations," Sanjay stated. He added, "Investigation is not yet complete...it's premature to say anything at this stage." Sanjay is chief of the Special Investigation Team on the case.

387.title: PM Modi chairs 5th high-level meeting on Russia-Ukraine war
387.article_body: PM Narendra Modi chaired the fifth high-level meeting on the Russia-Ukraine war at 8:30 pm on Wednesday, soon after the Indian Embassy in Ukraine asked nationals to leave Kharkiv immediately. Earlier, PM said, "We're working round the clock to bring back all Indian nationals who are stranded in the warzone." He said the government understands the hardships students are facing.

388.title: 2 Ukrainian footballers aged 21 and 25 killed amid war with Russia
388.article_body: FIFPRO, the global footballers' union, announced that two Ukrainian footballers, 21-year-old Vitalii Sapylo and 25-year-old Dmytro Martynenko, have been killed in Kyiv amid Ukraine-Russia war. Sapylo is said to have died in Kyiv last Friday after joining the army as a tank commander, while Martynenko was reportedly killed after Russian bombs hit his home in an apartment block.

389.title: Maha reports no COVID-related death for 1st time since April 2020
389.article_body: For the first time since April 1, 2020, Maharashtra reported no coronavirus-related death on Wednesday. As per the bulletin, 544 new COVID-19 cases were reported in Maharashtra today while 1,007 patients were discharged. Further, 38 cases of the new coronavirus variant Omicron were also reported. Notably, Maharashtra's capital Mumbai logged no COVID-related death for the sixth straight day.

390.title: Malta suspends sale of its passports to Russians & Belarusians
390.article_body: Malta on Wednesday stopped sale of its passports to Russians and Belarusians, citing lack of necessary checks on prospective citizenship buyers from these two countries amid Russia-Ukraine war. Malta has been selling its passports since 2014 as part of a 'citizenship by investment' scheme. It allows foreigners to acquire Maltese citizenship by investing a minimum of €600,000 in the country.

391.title: Scindia speaks in Marathi with Indian student in Romania, video surfaces
391.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia interacted with Indian students waiting for their flights in Romania's Bucharest. In a video retweeted by him on Twitter, Scindia can be heard speaking Marathi with a student. He asked the student his name and where he was from. When he replied that he was from Maharashtra, Scindia asked him to speak in Marathi.

392.title: Indian students were kicked, dragged by Ukrainian officials: UP student after returning
392.article_body: Uttar Pradesh-based student Anshika, who returned from Ukraine on Tuesday, said Indian students were kicked and dragged by Ukrainian officials near Romanian border. "Someone pushed the students [while crossing the border], injuring a girl. Romanian army even fired in air. After this, the Ukraine officials kicked the Indian students who had fallen down and they were also dragged," she added.

393.title: New sanctions against Belarus over Ukraine invasion approved by EU
393.article_body: The French Presidency of the EU on Wednesday said the EU has approved new sanctions against Belarus for its role in supporting Russia's invasion of Ukraine. EU officials said one of the aims of the new sanctions was to stop exports of Belarusian goods to the EU. The sanctions are aimed at economic sectors like steel, timber and potash.

394.title: Who is India-born Abhay Kumar Singh, Putin's legislator who justified Russia's invasion?
394.article_body: Abhay Kumar Singh is a deputat, a post similar to an MLA in India, from Kursk, a Western Russian city. He started his business in Kursk and later joined politics. Hailing from Patna in Bihar, Singh reportedly went to Russia in 1991 to study medicine. He joined Putin's United Russia Party in 2015 and won a provincial election in 2018.

395.title: I won't wish this to even an enemy: 20-yr-old Indian who returned from Ukraine
395.article_body: Yash Pal, a 20-year-old medical student from Thane who studies in Ukraine, on his return to India, said, "I went through hell in those five days. I heard blasts, firing and saw people bleeding and running." He added, "I won't wish anything like this to even an enemy." Yash made a 600 km journey from Kyiv to the Romanian border.

396.title: Putin 'knows no limit' to how much violence Russia will use in Ukraine: UK
396.article_body: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace on Wednesday said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "seems to know no limit to how much violence they will use in Ukraine". Wallace warned that Russia will "carpet-bomb, slowly surround and bombard" the cities of Ukraine in an act of "brutality". Notably, the Russian invasion of Ukraine entered its seventh day on Wednesday.

397.title: Sweden to send medical supplies to Ukraine amid Russian invasion
397.article_body: Sweden will send a "large amount" of medical supplies to Ukraine amid the Russian invasion, Swedish Health Minister Lena Hallengren said on Wednesday. The transfer of aid comes upon request from EU and will include one million face masks, bandages and disinfectants, along with other advanced equipment such as ventilators. Sweden closed its airspace to Russian planes on Monday.

398.title: Video shows farmers capturing & burning ₹114-crore Russian missile system in Ukraine
398.article_body: A video showing farmers burning a ₹114-crore Russian missile system in a Ukrainian field has surfaced online. Ukrainian mayor Borys Filatov claimed that farmers seized and destroyed the vehicle, adding that Russian soldiers were forced to run across the "Ukrainian fields like rats". "War is terrible grief, but these people (farmers) cannot be defeated," Filatov said.

399.title: Will free captive Russian soldiers whose mothers come to collect them: Ukraine
399.article_body: Ukraine on Wednesday announced that it would free any Russian prisoners whose mothers come to collect them in Ukraine's Kiev. "You need to call the phone number indicated in the flyer to find out if your son is captive or dead," Ukraine's Ministry of Defence said. The Ministry also shared a detailed path for the mothers to reach Kiev.

400.title: Akhilesh doesn't have strength to stop BJP from winning in UP: Owaisi
400.article_body: AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi said on Tuesday that Samajwadi Party (SP) supremo Akhilesh Yadav doesn't have "strength" to stop BJP from coming to power in UP. Owaisi added that despite SP's alliances with Congress and Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) in 2017 and 2019, it couldn't stop BJP from forming government. "Only Bhagidari Sankalp Morcha...can help UP get rid of...BJP,” he added.

401.title: Beyond silly: Manish Tewari on ministers greeting Ukraine returnees
401.article_body: Former Union Minister and Congress leader Manish Tewari on Wednesday criticised Union Ministers who have been greeting students rescued from war-hit Ukraine. "Young Indian students who barely escaped with the skin of their teeth...are being subjected to sanctimonious homilies by these ministers...in order to do their own political public relations and propaganda is beyond silly," he said.
